1
BERTRAM
RIANA, neighbour and friend to the Widow
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. In delivering my son from me, I bury a second husband.
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. And I in going, madam, weep o'er my father's death anew;
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. You shall find of the King a husband, madam; you, sir, a
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. What hope is there of his Majesty's amendment?
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He hath abandon'd his physicians, madam; under whose
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. This young gentlewoman had a father- O, that 'had,' how
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. How call'd you the man you speak of, madam?
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. He was famous, sir, in his profession, and it was his
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He was excellent indeed, madam; the King very lately spoke
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. What is it, my good lord, the King languishes of?
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. A fistula, my lord.
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. I heard not of it before.
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. I would it were not notorious. Was this gentlewoman the
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. His sole child, my lord, and bequeathed to my
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. Your commendations, madam, get from her tears.
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. 'Tis the best brine a maiden can season her praise in.
  HELENA. 
1
BERTRAM
LENA. I do affect a sorrow indeed, but I have it too.
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. Moderate lamentation is the right of the dead: excessive
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. If the living be enemy to the grief, the excess makes it
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. Madam, I desire your holy wishes.
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. How understand we that?
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. Be thou blest, Bertram, and succeed thy father
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He cannot want the best
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. Heaven bless him! Farewell, Bertram.            Exit
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. The best wishes that can be forg'd in your thoughts be
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. Farewell, pretty lady; you must hold the credit of your
  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
    And these great tears grace his remembrance more
    Than those I shed for him. What was he like?
    I have forgot him; my imagination
    Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.
    I am undone; there is no living, none,
    If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one
    That I should love a bright particular star
    And think to wed it, he is so above me.
    In his bright radiance and collateral light
    Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.
    Th' ambition in my love thus plagues itself:
    The hind that would be mated by the lion
    Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though a plague,
    To see him every hour; to sit and draw
    His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,
    In our heart's table-heart too capable
    Of every line and trick of his sweet favour.
    But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy
    Must sanctify his relics. Who comes here?
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Save you, fair queen!
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. And you, monarch!
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. No.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. And no.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Are you meditating on virginity?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Ay. You have some stain of soldier in you; let me ask you a
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Keep him out.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. But he assails; and our virginity, though valiant in the
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. There is none. Man, setting down before you, will
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Bless our poor virginity from underminers and blowers-up!
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Virginity being blown down, man will quicklier be blown
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. I will stand for 't a little, though therefore I die a
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. There's little can be said in 't; 'tis against the rule
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. How might one do, sir, to lose it to her own liking?
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Let me see. Marry, ill to like him that ne'er it likes.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Not my virginity yet.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. What one, i' faith?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. That I wish well. 'Tis pity-
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. What's pity?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
PAGE
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
    Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,
    Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,
    Might with effects of them follow our friends
    And show what we alone must think, which never
    Returns us thanks.

  PAGE. 
1
PAROLLES
GE. Monsieur Parolles, my lord calls for you.      Exit PAGE
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Little Helen, farewell; if I can remember thee, I will
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Monsieur Parolles, you were born under a charitable star.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Under Mars, I.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. I especially think, under Mars.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Why under Man?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. The wars hath so kept you under that you must needs be born
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. When he was predominant.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. When he was retrograde, I think, rather.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Why think you so?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. You go so much backward when you fight.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. That's for advantage.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. So is running away, when fear proposes the safety: but the
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. I am so full of business I cannot answer thee acutely. I
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit
  KING. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
NG. The Florentines and Senoys are by th' ears;
  FIRST 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
RST LORD. So 'tis reported, sir.
  KING. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
NG. Nay, 'tis most credible. We here receive it,
  FIRST 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
RST LORD. His love and wisdom,
  KING. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
NG. He hath arm'd our answer,
  SECOND 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
COND LORD. It well may serve
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. What's he comes here?
  FIRST 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
RST LORD. It is the Count Rousillon, my good lord,
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. Youth, thou bear'st thy father's face;
  BERTRAM. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
RTRAM. My thanks and duty are your Majesty's.
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. I would I had that corporal soundness now,
  BERTRAM. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
RTRAM. His good remembrance, sir,
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. Would I were with him! He would always say-
  SECOND 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
COND LORD. You're loved, sir;
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. I fill a place, I know't. How long is't, Count,
  BERTRAM. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
RTRAM. Some six months since, my lord.
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. If he were living, I would try him yet-

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Monsieur Parolles, you were born under a charitable star.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Under Mars, I.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. I especially think, under Mars.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Why under Man?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. The wars hath so kept you under that you must needs be born
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. When he was predominant.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. When he was retrograde, I think, rather.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Why think you so?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. You go so much backward when you fight.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. That's for advantage.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. So is running away, when fear proposes the safety: but the
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. I am so full of business I cannot answer thee acutely. I
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit
  KING. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
NG. The Florentines and Senoys are by th' ears;
  FIRST 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
RST LORD. So 'tis reported, sir.
  KING. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
NG. Nay, 'tis most credible. We here receive it,
  FIRST 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
RST LORD. His love and wisdom,
  KING. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
NG. He hath arm'd our answer,
  SECOND 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
COND LORD. It well may serve
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. What's he comes here?
  FIRST 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
RST LORD. It is the Count Rousillon, my good lord,
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. Youth, thou bear'st thy father's face;
  BERTRAM.

BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
RTRAM. My thanks and duty are your Majesty's.
  KING.

PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. I would I had that corporal soundness now,
  BERTRAM. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
RTRAM. His good remembrance, sir,
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. Would I were with him! He would always say-
  SECOND 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
COND LORD. You're loved, sir;
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. I fill a place, I know't. How long is't, Count,
  BERTRAM. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
RTRAM. Some six months since, my lord.
  KING. 
3
PAROLLES
BERTRAM
KING OF FRANCE
NG. If he were living, I would try him yet-
  BERTRAM.

PAROLLES

KING OF FRANCE

  COUNTESS.

  CLOWN.

  COUNTESS. 
4

COUNTESS
KING OF FRANCE

  CLOWN.

KING OF FRANCE

  COUNTESS.

PAROLLES

COUNTESS
KING OF FRANCE
UNTESS. Thy marriage, sooner than thy wickedness.
  CLOWN.

BERTRAM
COUNTESS
KING OF FRANCE

  COUNTESS.

  COUNTESS.

  CLOWN.

KING OF FRANCE

  COUNTESS.

  COUNTESS.

  STEWARD.

  COUNTESS.

KING OF FRANCE

  COUNTESS. 
5
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. YOU have discharg'd this honestly; keep it to yourself.
    Many likelihoods inform'd me of this before, which hung so
    tott'ring in the balance that I could neither believe nor
    misdoubt. Pray you leave me. Stall this in your bosom; and I
    thank you for your honest care. I will speak with you further
    anon.                                           Exit STEWARD
  HELENA. 
5
KING OF FRANCE

6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. Why, Helen, thou shalt have my leave and love,
    Means and attendants, and my loving greetings
    To those of mine in court. I'll stay at home,
    And pray God's blessing into thy attempt.
    Be gone to-morrow; and be sure of this,
    What I can help thee to thou shalt not miss.          Exeunt
  KING.

KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Here is my hand; the premises observ'd,
    Thy will by my performance shall be serv'd.
    So make the choice of thy own time, for I,
    Thy resolv'd patient, on thee still rely.
    More should I question thee, and more I must,
    Though more to know could not be more to trust,
    From whence thou cam'st, how tended on. But rest
    Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.
    Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed
    As high as word, my deed shall match thy deed.
                                              [Flourish. Exeunt]
  COUNTESS.

    Sit, my preserver, by thy patient's side;
    And with this healthful hand, whose banish'd sense
    Thou has repeal'd, a second time receive
    The confirmation of my promis'd gift,
    Which but attends thy naming.
  HELENA.

7
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
NG. Good fortune and the favour of the King
    Smile upon this contract; whose ceremony
    Shall seem expedient on the now-born brief,
    And be perform'd to-night. The solemn feast
    Shall more attend upon the coming space,
    Expecting absent friends. As thou lov'st her,
    Thy love's to me religious; else, does err.
              Exeunt all but LAFEU and PAROLLES who stay behind,
  LAFEU.

8
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Well, thou hast a son shall take this disgrace off me:
    scurvy, old, filthy, scurvy lord! Well, I must be patient; there
    is no fettering of authority. I'll beat him, by my life, if I can
    meet him with any convenience, an he were double and double a
    lord. I'll have no more pity of his age than I would have of-
    I'll beat him, and if I could but meet him again.
  LAFEU.

  PAROLLES.

  LAFEU.

KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
FEU. Go to, sir; you were beaten in Italy for picking a kernel
    out of a pomegranate; you are a vagabond, and no true traveller;
    you are more saucy with lords and honourable personages than the
    commission of your birth and virtue gives you heraldry. You are
    not worth another word, else I'd call you knave. I leave you.
  PAROLLES. 
8

    The King has done you wrong; but, hush, 'tis so.      Exeunt
  HELENA.

    And all the honours that can fly from us

    When better fall, for your avails they fell.
    To-morrow to th' field. Flourish.                     Exeunt
  COUNTESS.

  COUNTESS. 
9
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
LORDS
COUNTESS
UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
    recovered the King and undone me. I have wedded her, not bedded
    her; and sworn to make the "not" eternal. You shall hear I am run
    away; know it before the report come. If there be breadth enough
    in the world, I will hold a long distance. My duty to you.
                                           Your unfortunate son,
                                                       BERTRAM.'
    This is not well, rash and unbridled boy,
    To fly the favours of so good a king,
    To pluck his indignation on thy head
    By the misprizing of a maid too virtuous
    For the contempt of empire.
  CLOWN.

    the getting of children. Here they come will tell you more. For my
    part, I only hear your son was run away.                Exit

LORDS

RST GENTLEMAN. Madam, he's gone to serve the Duke of Florence.
  HELENA.

9
KING

9
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
    Nothing in France until he has no wife!
    Thou shalt have none, Rousillon, none in France
    Then hast thou all again. Poor lord! is't
    That chase thee from thy country, and expose
    Those tender limbs of thine to the event
    Of the non-sparing war? And is it I
    That drive thee from the sportive court, where thou
    Wast shot at with fair eyes, to be the mark
    Of smoky muskets? O you leaden messengers,
    That ride upon the violent speed of fire,
    Fly with false aim; move the still-piecing air,
    That sings with piercing; do not touch my lord.
    Whoever shoots at him, I set him there;
    Whoever charges on his forward breast,
    I am the caitiff that do hold him to't;
    And though I kill him not, I am the cause
    His death was so effected. Better 'twere
    I met the ravin lion when he roar'd
    With sharp constraint of hunger; better 'twere
    That all the miseries which nature owes
    Were mine at once. No; come thou home, Rousillon,
    Whence honour but of danger wins a scar,
    As oft it loses all. I will be gone.
    My being here it is that holds thee hence.
    Shall I stay here to do 't? No, no, although
    The air of paradise did fan the house,
    And angels offic'd all. I will be gone,
    That pitiful rumour may report my flight
    To consolate thine ear. Come, night; end, day.
    For with the dark, poor thief, I'll steal away.         Exit
  DUKE. 
9
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
KE. The General of our Horse thou art; and we,
  BERTRAM.

  DUKE.

KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
RTRAM. This very day,
    Great Mars, I put myself into thy file;
    Make me but like my thoughts, and I shall prove
    A lover of thy drum, hater of love.                   Exeunt
  COUNTESS.

10
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
UNTESS. What angel shall
  COUNTESS. 
11
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
UNTESS. What angel shall
    Bless this unworthy husband? He cannot thrive,
    Unless her prayers, whom heaven delights to hear
    And loves to grant, reprieve him from the wrath
    Of greatest justice. Write, write, Rinaldo,
    To this unworthy husband of his wife;
    Let every word weigh heavy of her worth
    That he does weigh too light. My greatest grief,
    Though little he do feel it, set down sharply.
    Dispatch the most convenient messenger.
    When haply he shall hear that she is gone
    He will return; and hope I may that she,
    Hearing so much, will speed her foot again,
    Led hither by pure love. Which of them both
    Is dearest to me I have no skill in sense
    To make distinction. Provide this messenger.
    My heart is heavy, and mine age is weak;
    Grief would have tears, and sorrow bids me speak.     Exeunt
  WIDOW. 
11
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
DOW. Nay, come; for if they do approach the city we shall lose
  DIANA.

LAFEU

PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. I humbly thank you.
    Please it this matron and this gentle maid
    To eat with us to-night; the charge and thanking
    Shall be for me, and, to requite you further,
    I will bestow some precepts of this virgin,
    Worthy the note.
    BOTH. We'll take your offer kindly.                   Exeunt
  SECOND

RST LORD. O, for the love of laughter, let him fetch his drum; he
    says he has a stratagem for't. When your lordship sees the bottom
    of his success in't, and to what metal this counterfeit lump of
    ore will be melted, if you give him not John Drum's
    entertainment, your inclining cannot be removed. Here he comes.

LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. Why then to-night
    Let us assay our plot; which, if it speed,
    Is wicked meaning in a lawful deed,
    And lawful meaning in a lawful act;
    Where both not sin, and yet a sinful fact.
    But let's about it.                                   Exeunt
  SECOND

  SECOND 
12
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
COND LORD. He must think us some band of strangers i' th'
    adversary's entertainment. Now he hath a smack of all
    neighbouring languages, therefore we must every one be a man of
    his own fancy; not to know what we speak one to another, so we
    seem to know, is to know straight our purpose: choughs' language,
    gabble enough, and good enough. As for you, interpreter, you must
    seem very politic. But couch, ho! here he comes; to beguile two
    hours in a sleep, and then to return and swear the lies he forges.
  PAROLLES.

WIDOW OF FLORENCE

13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ANA. For which live long to thank both heaven and me!
    You may so in the end.
    My mother told me just how he would woo,
    As if she sat in's heart; she says all men
    Have the like oaths. He had sworn to marry me
    When his wife's dead; therefore I'll lie with him
    When I am buried. Since Frenchmen are so braid,
    Marry that will, I live and die a maid.
    Only, in this disguise, I think't no sin
    To cozen him that would unjustly win.                   Exit
  SECOND

13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
COND LORD. Good Captain, will you give me a copy of the sonnet
    you writ to Diana in behalf of the Count Rousillon? An I were not
    a very coward I'd compel it of you; but fare you well.
                                        Exeunt BERTRAM and LORDS
  FIRST

  FIRST 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
RST SOLDIER. If you could find out a country where but women were
    that had received so much shame, you might begin an impudent
    nation. Fare ye well, sir; I am for France too; we shall speak of
    you there.                                Exit with SOLDIERS
  PAROLLES. 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
  PAROLLES. 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
    'Twould burst at this. Captain I'll be no more;
    But I will eat, and drink, and sleep as soft
    As captain shall. Simply the thing I am
    Shall make me live. Who knows himself a braggart,
    Let him fear this; for it will come to pass
    That every braggart shall be found an ass.
    Rust, sword; cool, blushes; and, Parolles, live
    Safest in shame. Being fool'd, by fool'ry thrive.
    There's place and means for every man alive.
    I'll after them.                                        Exit
  HELENA. 
13

FRENCH LORDS

DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. Yet, I pray you:
    But with the word the time will bring on summer,
    When briers shall have leaves as well as thorns
    And be as sweet as sharp. We must away;
    Our waggon is prepar'd, and time revives us.
    All's Well that Ends Well. Still the fine's the crown.
    Whate'er the course, the end is the renown.           Exeunt
  LAFEU.

14
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
GENTLEMAN
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. But this exceeding posting day and night
    Must wear your spirits low; we cannot help it.
    But since you have made the days and nights as one,
    To wear your gentle limbs in my affairs,
    Be bold you do so grow in my requital
    As nothing can unroot you.
  GENTLEMAN.

COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
FEU. You beg a single penny more; come, you shall ha't; save your
  PAROLLES. 
14

  PAROLLES.

    To bring forth this discov'ry. Seek these suitors.
    Go speedily, and bring again the Count.
                                               Exeunt ATTENDANTS
  COUNTESS.

COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
WIDOW
NG. I wonder, sir, sith wives are monsters to you.
    And that you fly them as you swear them lordship,
    Yet you desire to marry.
  DIANA.

                                                      Exit WIDOW
    The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,
    And he shall surety me. But for this lord
    Who hath abus'd me as he knows himself,
    Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him.
    He knows himself my bed he hath defil'd;
    And at that time he got his wife with child.
    Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick;
    So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick-
    And now behold the meaning.
  KING.

UNTESS OF ROUSILLON, mother to Bertram
  HELENA, 
0
LENA, a gentlewoman protected by the Countess
  DIANA,

  VIOLENTA,

  MARIANA,

BERTRAM
RIANA, neighbour and friend to the Widow
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. In delivering my son from me, I bury a second husband.
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. And I in going, madam, weep o'er my father's death anew;
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM

  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. What hope is there of his Majesty's amendment?
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM

  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. This young gentlewoman had a father- O, that 'had,' how
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM

  COUNTESS.

BERTRAM

  LAFEU. 
1

  BERTRAM.

  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM

  BERTRAM.

BERTRAM

  LAFEU.

  COUNTESS.

  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. Your commendations, madam, get from her tears.
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. 'Tis the best brine a maiden can season her praise in.
  HELENA. 
1
BERTRAM
LENA. I do affect a sorrow indeed, but I have it too.
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. Moderate lamentation is the right of the dead: excessive
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. If the living be enemy to the grief, the excess makes it
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. Madam, I desire your holy wishes.
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. How understand we that?
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. Be thou blest, Bertram, and succeed thy father
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He cannot want the best
  COUNTESS. 
1

  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. The best wishes that can be forg'd in your thoughts be
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. Farewell, pretty lady; you must hold the credit of your
  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
    And these great tears grace his remembrance more
    Than those I shed for him. What was he like?
    I have forgot him; my imagination
    Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.
    I am undone; there is no living, none,
    If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one
    That I should love a bright particular star
    And think to wed it, he is so above me.
    In his bright radiance and collateral light
    Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.
    Th' ambition in my love thus plagues itself:
    The hind that would be mated by the lion
    Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though a plague,
    To see him every hour; to sit and draw
    His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,
    In our heart's table-heart too capable
    Of every line and trick of his sweet favour.
    But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy
    Must sanctify his relics. Who comes here?
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Save you, fair queen!
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. And you, monarch!
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. No.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. And no.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Are you meditating on virginity?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Ay. You have some stain of soldier in you; let me ask you a
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Keep him out.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. But he assails; and our virginity, though valiant in the
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. There is none. Man, setting down before you, will
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Bless our poor virginity from underminers and blowers-up!
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Virginity being blown down, man will quicklier be blown
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. I will stand for 't a little, though therefore I die a
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. There's little can be said in 't; 'tis against the rule
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. How might one do, sir, to lose it to her own liking?
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Let me see. Marry, ill to like him that ne'er it likes.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Not my virginity yet.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. What one, i' faith?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. That I wish well. 'Tis pity-
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. What's pity?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
PAGE
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
    Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,
    Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,
    Might with effects of them follow our friends
    And show what we alone must think, which never
    Returns us thanks.
  PAGE. 
1
PAROLLES
GE. Monsieur Parolles, my lord calls for you.      Exit PAGE
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Little Helen, farewell; if I can remember thee, I will
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Monsieur Parolles, you were born under a charitable star.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Under Mars, I.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. I especially think, under Mars.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Why under Man?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. The wars hath so kept you under that you must needs be born
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. When he was predominant.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. When he was retrograde, I think, rather.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Why think you so?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. You go so much backward when you fight.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. That's for advantage.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. So is running away, when fear proposes the safety: but the
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. I am so full of business I cannot answer thee acutely. I
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit
  KING. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
NG. The Florentines and Senoys are by th' ears;
  FIRST

KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. YOU have discharg'd this honestly; keep it to yourself.
    Many likelihoods inform'd me of this before, which hung so
    tott'ring in the balance that I could neither believe nor
    misdoubt. Pray you leave me. Stall this in your bosom; and I
    thank you for your honest care. I will speak with you further
    anon.                                           Exit STEWARD
  HELENA.

6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. Why, Helen, thou shalt have my leave and love,
    Means and attendants, and my loving greetings
    To those of mine in court. I'll stay at home,
    And pray God's blessing into thy attempt.
    Be gone to-morrow; and be sure of this,
    What I can help thee to thou shalt not miss.          Exeunt
  KING.

  KING. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Here is my hand; the premises observ'd,
  KING. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Here is my hand; the premises observ'd,
    Thy will by my performance shall be serv'd.
    So make the choice of thy own time, for I,
    Thy resolv'd patient, on thee still rely.
    More should I question thee, and more I must,
    Though more to know could not be more to trust,
    From whence thou cam'st, how tended on. But rest
    Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.
    Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed
    As high as word, my deed shall match thy deed.
                                              [Flourish. Exeunt]
  COUNTESS.

    Sit, my preserver, by thy patient's side;
    And with this healthful hand, whose banish'd sense
    Thou has repeal'd, a second time receive
    The confirmation of my promis'd gift,
    Which but attends thy naming.
  HELENA.

7
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
NG. Good fortune and the favour of the King
    Smile upon this contract; whose ceremony
    Shall seem expedient on the now-born brief,
    And be perform'd to-night. The solemn feast
    Shall more attend upon the coming space,
    Expecting absent friends. As thou lov'st her,
    Thy love's to me religious; else, does err.
              Exeunt all but LAFEU and PAROLLES who stay behind,
  LAFEU.

PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Well, thou hast a son shall take this disgrace off me:
    scurvy, old, filthy, scurvy lord! Well, I must be patient; there
    is no fettering of authority. I'll beat him, by my life, if I can
    meet him with any convenience, an he were double and double a
    lord. I'll have no more pity of his age than I would have of-
    I'll beat him, and if I could but meet him again.
  LAFEU. 
8
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM

HELENA
LORDS

FEU. Sirrah, your lord and master's married; there's news for
  PAROLLES.

  LAFEU.

KING

BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
FEU. Go to, sir; you were beaten in Italy for picking a kernel
    out of a pomegranate; you are a vagabond, and no true traveller;
    you are more saucy with lords and honourable personages than the
    commission of your birth and virtue gives you heraldry. You are
    not worth another word, else I'd call you knave. I leave you.
  PAROLLES. 
8

    A young man married is a man that's marr'd.

    The King has done you wrong; but, hush, 'tis so.      Exeunt
  HELENA.

COUNTESS
KE. Welcome shall they be
    And all the honours that can fly from us
    Shall on them settle. You know your places well;
    When better fall, for your avails they fell.
    To-morrow to th' field. Flourish.                     Exeunt
  COUNTESS.

  COUNTESS. 
9
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
LORDS
COUNTESS
UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
    recovered the King and undone me. I have wedded her, not bedded
    her; and sworn to make the "not" eternal. You shall hear I am run
    away; know it before the report come. If there be breadth enough
    in the world, I will hold a long distance. My duty to you.
                                           Your unfortunate son,
                                                       BERTRAM.'
    This is not well, rash and unbridled boy,
    To fly the favours of so good a king,
    To pluck his indignation on thy head
    By the misprizing of a maid too virtuous
    For the contempt of empire.
  CLOWN.

BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
OWN. So say I, madam, if he run away, as I hear he does the
    danger is in standing to 't; that's the loss of men, though it be
    the getting of children. Here they come will tell you more. For my
    part, I only hear your son was run away.                Exit
  SECOND

KING

9
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
    Nothing in France until he has no wife!
    Thou shalt have none, Rousillon, none in France
    Then hast thou all again. Poor lord! is't
    That chase thee from thy country, and expose
    Those tender limbs of thine to the event
    Of the non-sparing war? And is it I
    That drive thee from the sportive court, where thou
    Wast shot at with fair eyes, to be the mark
    Of smoky muskets? O you leaden messengers,
    That ride upon the violent speed of fire,
    Fly with false aim; move the still-piecing air,
    That sings with piercing; do not touch my lord.
    Whoever shoots at him, I set him there;
    Whoever charges on his forward breast,
    I am the caitiff that do hold him to't;
    And though I kill him not, I am the cause
    His death was so effected. Better 'twere
    I met the ravin lion when he roar'd
    With sharp constraint of hunger; better 'twere
    That all the miseries which nature owes
    Were mine at once. No; come thou home, Rousillon,
    Whence honour but of danger wins a scar,
    As oft it loses all. I will be gone.
    My being here it is that holds thee hence.
    Shall I stay here to do 't? No, no, although
    The air of paradise did fan the house,
    And angels offic'd all. I will be gone,
    That pitiful rumour may report my flight
    To consolate thine ear. Come, night; end, day.
    For with the dark, poor thief, I'll steal away.         Exit
  DUKE. 
9
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
KE. The General of our Horse thou art; and we,
  BERTRAM.

HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
RTRAM. This very day,
    Great Mars, I put myself into thy file;
    Make me but like my thoughts, and I shall prove
    A lover of thy drum, hater of love.                   Exeunt
  COUNTESS.

10
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
UNTESS. What angel shall
  COUNTESS. 
11
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
UNTESS. What angel shall
    Bless this unworthy husband? He cannot thrive,
    Unless her prayers, whom heaven delights to hear
    And loves to grant, reprieve him from the wrath
    Of greatest justice. Write, write, Rinaldo,
    To this unworthy husband of his wife;
    Let every word weigh heavy of her worth
    That he does weigh too light. My greatest grief,
    Though little he do feel it, set down sharply.
    Dispatch the most convenient messenger.
    When haply he shall hear that she is gone
    He will return; and hope I may that she,
    Hearing so much, will speed her foot again,
    Led hither by pure love. Which of them both
    Is dearest to me I have no skill in sense
    To make distinction. Provide this messenger.
    My heart is heavy, and mine age is weak;
    Grief would have tears, and sorrow bids me speak.     Exeunt
  WIDOW. 
11
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
DOW. Nay, come; for if they do approach the city we shall lose
  DIANA.

11
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. I humbly thank you.
    Please it this matron and this gentle maid
    To eat with us to-night; the charge and thanking
    Shall be for me, and, to requite you further,
    I will bestow some precepts of this virgin,
    Worthy the note.
    BOTH. We'll take your offer kindly.                   Exeunt
  SECOND 
11
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES

LORDS

WIDOW OF FLORENCE
COND LORD. Nay, good my lord, put him to't; let him have his way.
  FIRST

KING

LAFEU

    of his success in't, and to what metal this counterfeit lump of
    ore will be melted, if you give him not John Drum's
    entertainment, your inclining cannot be removed. Here he comes.

LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. Why then to-night
    Let us assay our plot; which, if it speed,
    Is wicked meaning in a lawful deed,
    And lawful meaning in a lawful act;
    Where both not sin, and yet a sinful fact.
    But let's about it.                                   Exeunt
  SECOND

  SECOND 
12
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
COND LORD. He must think us some band of strangers i' th'
    adversary's entertainment. Now he hath a smack of all
    neighbouring languages, therefore we must every one be a man of
    his own fancy; not to know what we speak one to another, so we
    seem to know, is to know straight our purpose: choughs' language,
    gabble enough, and good enough. As for you, interpreter, you must
    seem very politic. But couch, ho! here he comes; to beguile two
    hours in a sleep, and then to return and swear the lies he forges.
  PAROLLES.

12
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ANA. For which live long to thank both heaven and me!
  DIANA. 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ANA. For which live long to thank both heaven and me!
    You may so in the end.
    My mother told me just how he would woo,
    As if she sat in's heart; she says all men
    Have the like oaths. He had sworn to marry me
    When his wife's dead; therefore I'll lie with him
    When I am buried. Since Frenchmen are so braid,
    Marry that will, I live and die a maid.
    Only, in this disguise, I think't no sin
    To cozen him that would unjustly win.                   Exit
  SECOND

MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
COND LORD. The web of our life is of a mingled yarn, good and ill
    together. Our virtues would be proud if our faults whipt them
    not; and our crimes would despair if they were not cherish'd by
    our virtues.
  SERVANT.

WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. Five or six thousand; but very weak and unserviceable.

SECOND FRENCH LORD

WIDOW OF FLORENCE
COND LORD. Good Captain, will you give me a copy of the sonnet
    you writ to Diana in behalf of the Count Rousillon? An I were not
    a very coward I'd compel it of you; but fare you well.
                                        Exeunt BERTRAM and LORDS

WIDOW OF FLORENCE
RST SOLDIER. If you could find out a country where but women were
    that had received so much shame, you might begin an impudent
    nation. Fare ye well, sir; I am for France too; we shall speak of
    you there.                                Exit with SOLDIERS
  PAROLLES. 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
  PAROLLES. 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
    'Twould burst at this. Captain I'll be no more;
    But I will eat, and drink, and sleep as soft
    As captain shall. Simply the thing I am
    Shall make me live. Who knows himself a braggart,
    Let him fear this; for it will come to pass
    That every braggart shall be found an ass.
    Rust, sword; cool, blushes; and, Parolles, live
    Safest in shame. Being fool'd, by fool'ry thrive.
    There's place and means for every man alive.
    I'll after them.                                        Exit
  HELENA. 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. That you may well perceive I have not wrong'd you!
  WIDOW.

13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. Yet, I pray you:
    But with the word the time will bring on summer,
    When briers shall have leaves as well as thorns
    And be as sweet as sharp. We must away;
    Our waggon is prepar'd, and time revives us.
    All's Well that Ends Well. Still the fine's the crown.
    Whate'er the course, the end is the renown.           Exeunt
  LAFEU.

  COUNTESS.

14
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
GENTLEMAN
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. But this exceeding posting day and night
    Must wear your spirits low; we cannot help it.
    But since you have made the days and nights as one,
    To wear your gentle limbs in my affairs,
    Be bold you do so grow in my requital
    As nothing can unroot you.
  GENTLEMAN.

  PAROLLES.

WIDOW OF FLORENCE
OWN. Foh! prithee stand away. A paper from Fortune's close-stool
    to give to a nobleman! Look here he comes himself.
  PAROLLES. 
14

ROLLES. My lord, I am a man whom Fortune hath cruelly scratch'd.
  LAFEU.

  DIANA.

                                                      Exit WIDOW
    The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,
    And he shall surety me. But for this lord
    Who hath abus'd me as he knows himself,
    Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him.
    He knows himself my bed he hath defil'd;
    And at that time he got his wife with child.
    Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick;
    So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick-
    And now behold the meaning.
  KING.

0
NG OF FRANCE
  THE 
0
E DUKE OF FLORENCE
  BERTRAM, 
0
RTRAM, Count of Rousillon
  LAFEU, 
0
FEU, an old lord
  PAROLLES, 
0
ROLLES, a follower of Bertram
  TWO 
0
O FRENCH LORDS, serving with Bertram
  STEWARD, 
0
EWARD, Servant to the Countess of Rousillon
  LAVACHE, 
0
VACHE, a clown and Servant to the Countess of Rousillon
  COUNTESS 
0
UNTESS OF ROUSILLON, mother to Bertram
  HELENA, 
0
LENA, a gentlewoman protected by the Countess
  DIANA, 
0
ANA, daughter to the Widow
  VIOLENTA, 
0
OLENTA, neighbour and friend to the Widow
  MARIANA, 
1
BERTRAM
RIANA, neighbour and friend to the Widow
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. In delivering my son from me, I bury a second husband.
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. And I in going, madam, weep o'er my father's death anew;
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. You shall find of the King a husband, madam; you, sir, a
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. What hope is there of his Majesty's amendment?
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He hath abandon'd his physicians, madam; under whose
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. This young gentlewoman had a father- O, that 'had,' how
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. How call'd you the man you speak of, madam?
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. He was famous, sir, in his profession, and it was his
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He was excellent indeed, madam; the King very lately spoke
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. What is it, my good lord, the King languishes of?
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. A fistula, my lord.
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. I heard not of it before.
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. I would it were not notorious. Was this gentlewoman the
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. His sole child, my lord, and bequeathed to my
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. Your commendations, madam, get from her tears.
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. 'Tis the best brine a maiden can season her praise in.
  HELENA. 
1
BERTRAM
LENA. I do affect a sorrow indeed, but I have it too.
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. Moderate lamentation is the right of the dead: excessive
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. If the living be enemy to the grief, the excess makes it
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. Madam, I desire your holy wishes.
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. How understand we that?
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. Be thou blest, Bertram, and succeed thy father
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He cannot want the best
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. Heaven bless him! Farewell, Bertram.            Exit
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. The best wishes that can be forg'd in your thoughts be
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. Farewell, pretty lady; you must hold the credit of your
  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
    And these great tears grace his remembrance more
    Than those I shed for him. What was he like?
    I have forgot him; my imagination
    Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.
    I am undone; there is no living, none,
    If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one
    That I should love a bright particular star
    And think to wed it, he is so above me.
    In his bright radiance and collateral light
    Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.
    Th' ambition in my love thus plagues itself:
    The hind that would be mated by the lion
    Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though a plague,
    To see him every hour; to sit and draw
    His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,
    In our heart's table-heart too capable
    Of every line and trick of his sweet favour.
    But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy
    Must sanctify his relics. Who comes here?
  PAROLLES. 
1

  HELENA.

  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
PAGE
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
    Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,
    Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,
    Might with effects of them follow our friends
    And show what we alone must think, which never
    Returns us thanks.
  PAGE. 
1
PAROLLES
GE. Monsieur Parolles, my lord calls for you.      Exit PAGE
  PAROLLES. 
1

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Monsieur Parolles, you were born under a charitable star.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Under Mars, I.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. I especially think, under Mars.
  PAROLLES.

PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. The wars hath so kept you under that you must needs be born
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES

  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. You go so much backward when you fight.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. That's for advantage.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. So is running away, when fear proposes the safety: but the
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. I am so full of business I cannot answer thee acutely. I
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit

COUNTESS
UNTESS. YOU have discharg'd this honestly; keep it to yourself.
    Many likelihoods inform'd me of this before, which hung so
    tott'ring in the balance that I could neither believe nor
    misdoubt. Pray you leave me. Stall this in your bosom; and I
    thank you for your honest care. I will speak with you further
    anon.                                           Exit STEWARD

HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. Why, Helen, thou shalt have my leave and love,
    Means and attendants, and my loving greetings
    To those of mine in court. I'll stay at home,
    And pray God's blessing into thy attempt.
    Be gone to-morrow; and be sure of this,
    What I can help thee to thou shalt not miss.          Exeunt
  KING.

PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. We thank you, maiden;
  HELENA. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. My duty then shall pay me for my pains.
  KING. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. I cannot give thee less, to be call'd grateful.
  HELENA. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. What I can do can do no hurt to try,
  KING. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. I must not hear thee. Fare thee well, kind maid;
  HELENA. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. Inspired merit so by breath is barr'd.
  KING. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Art thou so confident? Within what space
  HELENA.

KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA

LENA. The greatest Grace lending grace.
  KING.

LAFEU

COUNTESS

  HELENA.

  KING.

  HELENA.

  KING. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Make thy demand.
  HELENA. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. But will you make it even?
  KING. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Ay, by my sceptre and my hopes of heaven.
  HELENA. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. Then shalt thou give me with thy kingly hand
  KING. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Here is my hand; the premises observ'd,
  KING. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Here is my hand; the premises observ'd,
    Thy will by my performance shall be serv'd.
    So make the choice of thy own time, for I,
    Thy resolv'd patient, on thee still rely.
    More should I question thee, and more I must,
    Though more to know could not be more to trust,
    From whence thou cam'st, how tended on. But rest
    Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.
    Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed
    As high as word, my deed shall match thy deed.
                                              [Flourish. Exeunt]
  COUNTESS. 
6
KING

  CLOWN.

  COUNTESS.

KING

LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
OWN. O Lord, sir!-Thick, thick; spare not me.
  COUNTESS.

KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS

  CLOWN.

  COUNTESS.

  CLOWN.

HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
NG. Go, call before me all the lords in court.
                                               Exit an ATTENDANT
    Sit, my preserver, by thy patient's side;
    And with this healthful hand, whose banish'd sense
    Thou has repeal'd, a second time receive
    The confirmation of my promis'd gift,
    Which but attends thy naming.
  HELENA.

7
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
NG. Good fortune and the favour of the King
    Smile upon this contract; whose ceremony
    Shall seem expedient on the now-born brief,
    And be perform'd to-night. The solemn feast
    Shall more attend upon the coming space,
    Expecting absent friends. As thou lov'st her,
    Thy love's to me religious; else, does err.
              Exeunt all but LAFEU and PAROLLES who stay behind,
  LAFEU.

FEU. Ay, with all my heart; and thou art worthy of it.

  PAROLLES.

KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Well, thou hast a son shall take this disgrace off me:
    scurvy, old, filthy, scurvy lord! Well, I must be patient; there
    is no fettering of authority. I'll beat him, by my life, if I can
    meet him with any convenience, an he were double and double a
    lord. I'll have no more pity of his age than I would have of-
    I'll beat him, and if I could but meet him again.
  LAFEU.

  LAFEU.

BERTRAM

PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
FEU. Go to, sir; you were beaten in Italy for picking a kernel
    out of a pomegranate; you are a vagabond, and no true traveller;
    you are more saucy with lords and honourable personages than the
    commission of your birth and virtue gives you heraldry. You are
    not worth another word, else I'd call you knave. I leave you.
  PAROLLES. 
8

  BERTRAM.

    A young man married is a man that's marr'd.
    Therefore away, and leave her bravely; go.
    The King has done you wrong; but, hush, 'tis so.      Exeunt
  HELENA.

KE. Welcome shall they be
    And all the honours that can fly from us
    Shall on them settle. You know your places well;
    When better fall, for your avails they fell.
    To-morrow to th' field. Flourish.                     Exeunt
  COUNTESS.

UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
    recovered the King and undone me. I have wedded her, not bedded
    her; and sworn to make the "not" eternal. You shall hear I am run
    away; know it before the report come. If there be breadth enough
    in the world, I will hold a long distance. My duty to you.
                                           Your unfortunate son,
                                                       BERTRAM.'
    This is not well, rash and unbridled boy,
    To fly the favours of so good a king,
    To pluck his indignation on thy head
    By the misprizing of a maid too virtuous
    For the contempt of empire.
  CLOWN.

COUNTESS
OWN. So say I, madam, if he run away, as I hear he does the
    danger is in standing to 't; that's the loss of men, though it be
    the getting of children. Here they come will tell you more. For my
    part, I only hear your son was run away.                Exit
  SECOND

9
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
    Nothing in France until he has no wife!
    Thou shalt have none, Rousillon, none in France
    Then hast thou all again. Poor lord! is't
    That chase thee from thy country, and expose
    Those tender limbs of thine to the event
    Of the non-sparing war? And is it I
    That drive thee from the sportive court, where thou
    Wast shot at with fair eyes, to be the mark
    Of smoky muskets? O you leaden messengers,
    That ride upon the violent speed of fire,
    Fly with false aim; move the still-piecing air,
    That sings with piercing; do not touch my lord.
    Whoever shoots at him, I set him there;
    Whoever charges on his forward breast,
    I am the caitiff that do hold him to't;
    And though I kill him not, I am the cause
    His death was so effected. Better 'twere
    I met the ravin lion when he roar'd
    With sharp constraint of hunger; better 'twere
    That all the miseries which nature owes
    Were mine at once. No; come thou home, Rousillon,
    Whence honour but of danger wins a scar,
    As oft it loses all. I will be gone.
    My being here it is that holds thee hence.
    Shall I stay here to do 't? No, no, although
    The air of paradise did fan the house,
    And angels offic'd all. I will be gone,
    That pitiful rumour may report my flight
    To consolate thine ear. Come, night; end, day.
    For with the dark, poor thief, I'll steal away.         Exit
  DUKE. 
9
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU

PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
KE. The General of our Horse thou art; and we,
  BERTRAM.

RTRAM. This very day,
    Great Mars, I put myself into thy file;
    Make me but like my thoughts, and I shall prove
    A lover of thy drum, hater of love.                   Exeunt
  COUNTESS.

KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
UNTESS. What angel shall
  COUNTESS. 
11
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
UNTESS. What angel shall
    Bless this unworthy husband? He cannot thrive,
    Unless her prayers, whom heaven delights to hear
    And loves to grant, reprieve him from the wrath
    Of greatest justice. Write, write, Rinaldo,
    To this unworthy husband of his wife;
    Let every word weigh heavy of her worth
    That he does weigh too light. My greatest grief,
    Though little he do feel it, set down sharply.
    Dispatch the most convenient messenger.
    When haply he shall hear that she is gone
    He will return; and hope I may that she,
    Hearing so much, will speed her foot again,
    Led hither by pure love. Which of them both
    Is dearest to me I have no skill in sense
    To make distinction. Provide this messenger.
    My heart is heavy, and mine age is weak;
    Grief would have tears, and sorrow bids me speak.     Exeunt
  WIDOW. 
11
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
DOW. Nay, come; for if they do approach the city we shall lose
  DIANA.

PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
RIANA. And your courtesy, for a ring-carrier!
                              Exeunt BERTRAM, PAROLLES, and ARMY
  WIDOW.

11
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. I humbly thank you.
    Please it this matron and this gentle maid
    To eat with us to-night; the charge and thanking
    Shall be for me, and, to requite you further,
    I will bestow some precepts of this virgin,
    Worthy the note.
    BOTH. We'll take your offer kindly.                   Exeunt
  SECOND

WIDOW OF FLORENCE
RST LORD. O, for the love of laughter, let him fetch his drum; he
    says he has a stratagem for't. When your lordship sees the bottom
    of his success in't, and to what metal this counterfeit lump of
    ore will be melted, if you give him not John Drum's
    entertainment, your inclining cannot be removed. Here he comes.
  SECOND

BERTRAM

CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. Why then to-night
    Let us assay our plot; which, if it speed,
    Is wicked meaning in a lawful deed,
    And lawful meaning in a lawful act;
    Where both not sin, and yet a sinful fact.
    But let's about it.                                   Exeunt
  SECOND

  SECOND 
12
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
COND LORD. He must think us some band of strangers i' th'
    adversary's entertainment. Now he hath a smack of all
    neighbouring languages, therefore we must every one be a man of
    his own fancy; not to know what we speak one to another, so we
    seem to know, is to know straight our purpose: choughs' language,
    gabble enough, and good enough. As for you, interpreter, you must
    seem very politic. But couch, ho! here he comes; to beguile two
    hours in a sleep, and then to return and swear the lies he forges.
  PAROLLES.

13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ANA. For which live long to thank both heaven and me!
    You may so in the end.
    My mother told me just how he would woo,
    As if she sat in's heart; she says all men
    Have the like oaths. He had sworn to marry me
    When his wife's dead; therefore I'll lie with him
    When I am buried. Since Frenchmen are so braid,
    Marry that will, I live and die a maid.
    Only, in this disguise, I think't no sin
    To cozen him that would unjustly win.                   Exit
  SECOND

COND LORD. The web of our life is of a mingled yarn, good and ill
    together. Our virtues would be proud if our faults whipt them
    not; and our crimes would despair if they were not cherish'd by
    our virtues.
  SERVANT.

DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
COND LORD. Good Captain, will you give me a copy of the sonnet
    you writ to Diana in behalf of the Count Rousillon? An I were not
    a very coward I'd compel it of you; but fare you well.
                                        Exeunt BERTRAM and LORDS
  FIRST 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
RST SOLDIER. You are undone, Captain, all but your scarf; that
  PAROLLES. 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. Who cannot be crush'd with a plot?
  FIRST 
13
FRENCH LORDS

KING OF FRANCE

SECOND FRENCH LORD

WIDOW OF FLORENCE
RST SOLDIER. If you could find out a country where but women were
  FIRST 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
RST SOLDIER. If you could find out a country where but women were
    that had received so much shame, you might begin an impudent
    nation. Fare ye well, sir; I am for France too; we shall speak of
    you there.                                Exit with SOLDIERS
  PAROLLES. 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
  PAROLLES. 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
    'Twould burst at this. Captain I'll be no more;
    But I will eat, and drink, and sleep as soft
    As captain shall. Simply the thing I am
    Shall make me live. Who knows himself a braggart,
    Let him fear this; for it will come to pass
    That every braggart shall be found an ass.
    Rust, sword; cool, blushes; and, Parolles, live
    Safest in shame. Being fool'd, by fool'ry thrive.
    There's place and means for every man alive.
    I'll after them.                                        Exit
  HELENA. 
13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. That you may well perceive I have not wrong'd you!
  WIDOW.

13
FRENCH LORDS

DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU

13
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. Yet, I pray you:
    But with the word the time will bring on summer,
    When briers shall have leaves as well as thorns
    And be as sweet as sharp. We must away;
    Our waggon is prepar'd, and time revives us.
    All's Well that Ends Well. Still the fine's the crown.
    Whate'er the course, the end is the renown.           Exeunt
  LAFEU. 
13

SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
FEU. No, no, no, son was misled with a snipt-taffeta fellow
  COUNTESS.

  HELENA. 
14
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
GENTLEMAN
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
LENA. But this exceeding posting day and night
    Must wear your spirits low; we cannot help it.
    But since you have made the days and nights as one,
    To wear your gentle limbs in my affairs,
    Be bold you do so grow in my requital
    As nothing can unroot you.
  GENTLEMAN.

  PAROLLES.

FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
GENTLEMAN
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. Nay, you need not to stop your nose, sir; I spake but by
  CLOWN. 
14
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
GENTLEMAN
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
OWN. Indeed, sir, if your metaphor stink, I will stop my nose; or
  PAROLLES. 
14
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
GENTLEMAN
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. Pray you, sir, deliver me this paper.
  CLOWN. 
14
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
GENTLEMAN
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
OWN. Foh! prithee stand away. A paper from Fortune's close-stool
  CLOWN. 
14
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
GENTLEMAN
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
OWN. Foh! prithee stand away. A paper from Fortune's close-stool
    to give to a nobleman! Look here he comes himself.
  PAROLLES. 
14
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU

CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. My lord, I am a man whom Fortune hath cruelly scratch'd.
  LAFEU. 
14
FRENCH LORDS

DUKE OF FLORENCE

MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
FEU. And what would you have me to do? 'Tis too late to pare her
  PAROLLES.

WIDOW OF FLORENCE
ROLLES. I beseech your honour to hear me one single word.
  LAFEU.

COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
FEU. You beg a single penny more; come, you shall ha't; save your
  PAROLLES.

WIDOW OF FLORENCE

  PAROLLES.

COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
FEU. Was I, in sooth? And I was the first that lost thee.
  PAROLLES.

COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
NG. The heavens have thought well on thee, Lafeu,
    To bring forth this discov'ry. Seek these suitors.
    Go speedily, and bring again the Count.
                                               Exeunt ATTENDANTS
  COUNTESS.

16
FRENCH LORDS
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
GENTLEMAN
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
MESSENGER
LORDS
SECOND FRENCH LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW OF FLORENCE
WIDOW
NG. I wonder, sir, sith wives are monsters to you.
    And that you fly them as you swear them lordship,
    Yet you desire to marry.
  DIANA. 
16

                                                      Exit WIDOW
    The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,
    And he shall surety me. But for this lord
    Who hath abus'd me as he knows himself,
    Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him.
    He knows himself my bed he hath defil'd;
    And at that time he got his wife with child.
    Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick;
    So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick-
    And now behold the meaning.
  KING. 
16

0
NG OF FRANCE
  THE 
0
E DUKE OF FLORENCE
  BERTRAM, 
0
RTRAM, Count of Rousillon
  LAFEU, 
0
FEU, an old lord
  PAROLLES, 
0
ROLLES, a follower of Bertram
  TWO 
0
O FRENCH LORDS, serving with Bertram
  STEWARD, 
0
EWARD, Servant to the Countess of Rousillon
  LAVACHE, 
0
VACHE, a clown and Servant to the Countess of Rousillon
  COUNTESS 
0
UNTESS OF ROUSILLON, mother to Bertram
  HELENA, 
0
LENA, a gentlewoman protected by the Countess
  DIANA, 
0
ANA, daughter to the Widow
  VIOLENTA, 
0
OLENTA, neighbour and friend to the Widow
  MARIANA, 
1
BERTRAM
RIANA, neighbour and friend to the Widow
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. In delivering my son from me, I bury a second husband.
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. And I in going, madam, weep o'er my father's death anew;
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. You shall find of the King a husband, madam; you, sir, a
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. What hope is there of his Majesty's amendment?
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He hath abandon'd his physicians, madam; under whose
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. This young gentlewoman had a father- O, that 'had,' how
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. How call'd you the man you speak of, madam?
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. He was famous, sir, in his profession, and it was his
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He was excellent indeed, madam; the King very lately spoke
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. What is it, my good lord, the King languishes of?
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. A fistula, my lord.
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. I heard not of it before.
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. I would it were not notorious. Was this gentlewoman the
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. His sole child, my lord, and bequeathed to my
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. Your commendations, madam, get from her tears.
  COUNTESS.

BERTRAM

  LAFEU.

  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
    And these great tears grace his remembrance more
    Than those I shed for him. What was he like?
    I have forgot him; my imagination
    Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.
    I am undone; there is no living, none,
    If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one
    That I should love a bright particular star
    And think to wed it, he is so above me.
    In his bright radiance and collateral light
    Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.
    Th' ambition in my love thus plagues itself:
    The hind that would be mated by the lion
    Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though a plague,
    To see him every hour; to sit and draw
    His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,
    In our heart's table-heart too capable
    Of every line and trick of his sweet favour.
    But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy
    Must sanctify his relics. Who comes here?
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Save you, fair queen!
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. And you, monarch!
  PAROLLES.

  HELENA.

  HELENA.

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
PAGE
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
    Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,
    Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,
    Might with effects of them follow our friends
    And show what we alone must think, which never
    Returns us thanks.
  PAGE.

PAROLLES

  HELENA.

PAROLLES

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA.

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. You go so much backward when you fight.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. That's for advantage.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. So is running away, when fear proposes the safety: but the
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. I am so full of business I cannot answer thee acutely. I
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
KING OF FRANCE
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit
  KING.

HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. YOU have discharg'd this honestly; keep it to yourself.
    Many likelihoods inform'd me of this before, which hung so
    tott'ring in the balance that I could neither believe nor
    misdoubt. Pray you leave me. Stall this in your bosom; and I
    thank you for your honest care. I will speak with you further
    anon.                                           Exit STEWARD

KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. Why, Helen, thou shalt have my leave and love,
    Means and attendants, and my loving greetings
    To those of mine in court. I'll stay at home,
    And pray God's blessing into thy attempt.
    Be gone to-morrow; and be sure of this,
    What I can help thee to thou shalt not miss.          Exeunt
  KING.

  KING. 
6
KING
KING OF FRANCE
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Here is my hand; the premises observ'd,
    Thy will by my performance shall be serv'd.
    So make the choice of thy own time, for I,
    Thy resolv'd patient, on thee still rely.
    More should I question thee, and more I must,
    Though more to know could not be more to trust,
    From whence thou cam'st, how tended on. But rest
    Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.
    Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed
    As high as word, my deed shall match thy deed.
                                              [Flourish. Exeunt]
  COUNTESS.

    Sit, my preserver, by thy patient's side;
    And with this healthful hand, whose banish'd sense
    Thou has repeal'd, a second time receive
    The confirmation of my promis'd gift,
    Which but attends thy naming.
  HELENA.

7
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
NG. Good fortune and the favour of the King
    Smile upon this contract; whose ceremony
    Shall seem expedient on the now-born brief,
    And be perform'd to-night. The solemn feast
    Shall more attend upon the coming space,
    Expecting absent friends. As thou lov'st her,
    Thy love's to me religious; else, does err.
              Exeunt all but LAFEU and PAROLLES who stay behind,
  LAFEU.

  PAROLLES.

  PAROLLES.

  LAFEU.

BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS

FEU. Ay, with all my heart; and thou art worthy of it.

  PAROLLES.

  LAFEU.

  PAROLLES.

BERTRAM
PAROLLES

  PAROLLES. 
7
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Well, thou hast a son shall take this disgrace off me:
  PAROLLES. 
8
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Well, thou hast a son shall take this disgrace off me:
    scurvy, old, filthy, scurvy lord! Well, I must be patient; there
    is no fettering of authority. I'll beat him, by my life, if I can
    meet him with any convenience, an he were double and double a
    lord. I'll have no more pity of his age than I would have of-
    I'll beat him, and if I could but meet him again.
  LAFEU. 
8
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
FEU. Sirrah, your lord and master's married; there's news for
  PAROLLES.

ROLLES. I most unfeignedly beseech your lordship to make some
  LAFEU.

  PAROLLES.

  LAFEU. 
8
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
FEU. Go to, sir; you were beaten in Italy for picking a kernel
    out of a pomegranate; you are a vagabond, and no true traveller;
    you are more saucy with lords and honourable personages than the
    commission of your birth and virtue gives you heraldry. You are
    not worth another word, else I'd call you knave. I leave you.
  PAROLLES. 
8
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Good, very, good, it is so then. Good, very good; let it
  BERTRAM. 
8
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
RTRAM. Undone, and forfeited to cares for ever!
  PAROLLES.

KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES

ROLLES. What's the matter, sweetheart?

KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Why, these balls bound; there's noise in it. 'Tis hard:
  PAROLLES. 
8
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
LORDS
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Why, these balls bound; there's noise in it. 'Tis hard:
    A young man married is a man that's marr'd.
    Therefore away, and leave her bravely; go.
    The King has done you wrong; but, hush, 'tis so.      Exeunt
  HELENA. 
8
KING
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU

LENA. My mother greets me kindly; is she well?
  CLOWN.

  HELENA.

COUNTESS

  PAROLLES.

    make us friends; I will pursue the amity
  PAROLLES.

  DUKE. 
8
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
LORDS
COUNTESS
KE. Welcome shall they be
    And all the honours that can fly from us
    Shall on them settle. You know your places well;
    When better fall, for your avails they fell.
    To-morrow to th' field. Flourish.                     Exeunt
  COUNTESS.

  COUNTESS. 
9
KING
DUKE OF FLORENCE
KING OF FRANCE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
LORDS
COUNTESS
UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
    recovered the King and undone me. I have wedded her, not bedded
    her; and sworn to make the "not" eternal. You shall hear I am run
    away; know it before the report come. If there be breadth enough
    in the world, I will hold a long distance. My duty to you.
                                           Your unfortunate son,
                                                       BERTRAM.'
    This is not well, rash and unbridled boy,
    To fly the favours of so good a king,
    To pluck his indignation on thy head
    By the misprizing of a maid too virtuous
    For the contempt of empire.
  CLOWN.

OWN. So say I, madam, if he run away, as I hear he does the
    danger is in standing to 't; that's the loss of men, though it be
    the getting of children. Here they come will tell you more. For my
    part, I only hear your son was run away.                Exit
  SECOND
