  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
    And these great tears grace his remembrance more
    Than those I shed for him. What was he like?
    I have forgot him; my imagination
    Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.
    I am undone; there is no living, none,
    If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one
    That I should love a bright particular star
    And think to wed it, he is so above me.
    In his bright radiance and collateral light
    Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.
    Th' ambition in my love thus plagues itself:
    The hind that would be mated by the lion
    Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though a plague,
    To see him every hour; to sit and draw
    His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,
    In our heart's table-heart too capable
    Of every line and trick of his sweet favour.
    But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy
    Must sanctify his relics. Who comes here?
  PAROLLES. 
0

  HELENA.

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA. 
0
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
  HELENA. 
0
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
    Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,
    Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,
    Might with effects of them follow our friends
    And show what we alone must think, which never
    Returns us thanks.

  HELENA.

  PAROLLES. 
0

  HELENA.

  PAROLLES. 
0

  HELENA. 
0
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
  HELENA. 
0
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit

    Thy will by my performance shall be serv'd.
    So make the choice of thy own time, for I,
    Thy resolv'd patient, on thee still rely.
    More should I question thee, and more I must,
    Though more to know could not be more to trust,
    From whence thou cam'st, how tended on. But rest
    Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.
    Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed
    As high as word, my deed shall match thy deed.

UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
    recovered the King and undone me. I have wedded her, not bedded
    her; and sworn to make the "not" eternal. You shall hear I am run
    away; know it before the report come. If there be breadth enough
    in the world, I will hold a long distance. My duty to you.
                                           Your unfortunate son,
                                                       BERTRAM.'
    This is not well, rash and unbridled boy,
    To fly the favours of so good a king,
    To pluck his indignation on thy head
    By the misprizing of a maid too virtuous
    For the contempt of empire.
  CLOWN.

  HELENA.

LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
  HELENA. 
0
LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
    Nothing in France until he has no wife!
    Thou shalt have none, Rousillon, none in France
    Then hast thou all again. Poor lord! is't
    That chase thee from thy country, and expose
    Those tender limbs of thine to the event
    Of the non-sparing war? And is it I
    That drive thee from the sportive court, where thou
    Wast shot at with fair eyes, to be the mark
    Of smoky muskets? O you leaden messengers,
    That ride upon the violent speed of fire,
    Fly with false aim; move the still-piecing air,
    That sings with piercing; do not touch my lord.
    Whoever shoots at him, I set him there;
    Whoever charges on his forward breast,
    I am the caitiff that do hold him to't;
    And though I kill him not, I am the cause
    His death was so effected. Better 'twere
    I met the ravin lion when he roar'd
    With sharp constraint of hunger; better 'twere
    That all the miseries which nature owes
    Were mine at once. No; come thou home, Rousillon,
    Whence honour but of danger wins a scar,
    As oft it loses all. I will be gone.
    My being here it is that holds thee hence.
    Shall I stay here to do 't? No, no, although
    The air of paradise did fan the house,
    And angels offic'd all. I will be gone,
    That pitiful rumour may report my flight
    To consolate thine ear. Come, night; end, day.
    For with the dark, poor thief, I'll steal away.         Exit
  DUKE. 
0
KE. The General of our Horse thou art; and we,
  BERTRAM. 
0
RTRAM. Sir, it is
  DUKE. 
0
KE. Then go thou forth;
  BERTRAM. 
0
RTRAM. This very day,
  BERTRAM. 
0
RTRAM. This very day,
    Great Mars, I put myself into thy file;
    Make me but like my thoughts, and I shall prove
    A lover of thy drum, hater of love.                   Exeunt
  COUNTESS. 
0
UNTESS. Alas! and would you take the letter of her?
  STEWARD. 
0
EWARD.  [Reads]  'I am Saint Jaques' pilgrim, thither gone.
  COUNTESS. 
0
UNTESS. Ah, what sharp stings are in her mildest words!
  STEWARD. 
0
EWARD. Pardon me, madam;
  COUNTESS. 
0
UNTESS. What angel shall
  COUNTESS. 
0
UNTESS. What angel shall
    Bless this unworthy husband? He cannot thrive,
    Unless her prayers, whom heaven delights to hear
    And loves to grant, reprieve him from the wrath
    Of greatest justice. Write, write, Rinaldo,
    To this unworthy husband of his wife;
    Let every word weigh heavy of her worth
    That he does weigh too light. My greatest grief,
    Though little he do feel it, set down sharply.
    Dispatch the most convenient messenger.
    When haply he shall hear that she is gone
    He will return; and hope I may that she,
    Hearing so much, will speed her foot again,
    Led hither by pure love. Which of them both
    Is dearest to me I have no skill in sense
    To make distinction. Provide this messenger.
    My heart is heavy, and mine age is weak;
    Grief would have tears, and sorrow bids me speak.     Exeunt

    adversary's entertainment. Now he hath a smack of all
    neighbouring languages, therefore we must every one be a man of
    his own fancy; not to know what we speak one to another, so we
    seem to know, is to know straight our purpose: choughs' language,
    gabble enough, and good enough. As for you, interpreter, you must
    seem very politic. But couch, ho! here he comes; to beguile two
    hours in a sleep, and then to return and swear the lies he forges.

  DIANA. 
0
ANA. For which live long to thank both heaven and me!
    You may so in the end.
    My mother told me just how he would woo,
    As if she sat in's heart; she says all men
    Have the like oaths. He had sworn to marry me
    When his wife's dead; therefore I'll lie with him
    When I am buried. Since Frenchmen are so braid,
    Marry that will, I live and die a maid.
    Only, in this disguise, I think't no sin
    To cozen him that would unjustly win.                   Exit

  PAROLLES.

ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
    'Twould burst at this. Captain I'll be no more;
    But I will eat, and drink, and sleep as soft
    As captain shall. Simply the thing I am
    Shall make me live. Who knows himself a braggart,
    Let him fear this; for it will come to pass
    That every braggart shall be found an ass.
    Rust, sword; cool, blushes; and, Parolles, live
    Safest in shame. Being fool'd, by fool'ry thrive.
    There's place and means for every man alive.
    I'll after them.                                        Exit

    And be as sweet as sharp. We must away;
    Our waggon is prepar'd, and time revives us.
    All's Well that Ends Well. Still the fine's the crown.
    Whate'er the course, the end is the renown.           Exeunt

                                                      Exit WIDOW
    The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,
    And he shall surety me. But for this lord
    Who hath abus'd me as he knows himself,
    Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him.
    He knows himself my bed he hath defil'd;
    And at that time he got his wife with child.
    Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick;
    So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick-
    And now behold the meaning.

  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
    And these great tears grace his remembrance more
    Than those I shed for him. What was he like?
    I have forgot him; my imagination
    Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.
    I am undone; there is no living, none,
    If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one
    That I should love a bright particular star
    And think to wed it, he is so above me.
    In his bright radiance and collateral light
    Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.
    Th' ambition in my love thus plagues itself:
    The hind that would be mated by the lion
    Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though a plague,
    To see him every hour; to sit and draw
    His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,
    In our heart's table-heart too capable
    Of every line and trick of his sweet favour.
    But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy
    Must sanctify his relics. Who comes here?

  HELENA. 
0
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
    Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,
    Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,
    Might with effects of them follow our friends
    And show what we alone must think, which never
    Returns us thanks.

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA.

  HELENA. 
0
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit

    Thy will by my performance shall be serv'd.
    So make the choice of thy own time, for I,
    Thy resolv'd patient, on thee still rely.
    More should I question thee, and more I must,
    Though more to know could not be more to trust,
    From whence thou cam'st, how tended on. But rest
    Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.
    Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed
    As high as word, my deed shall match thy deed.

    her; and sworn to make the "not" eternal. You shall hear I am run
    away; know it before the report come. If there be breadth enough
    in the world, I will hold a long distance. My duty to you.
                                           Your unfortunate son,
                                                       BERTRAM.'
    This is not well, rash and unbridled boy,
    To fly the favours of so good a king,
    To pluck his indignation on thy head
    By the misprizing of a maid too virtuous
    For the contempt of empire.

LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
  HELENA. 
0
LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
    Nothing in France until he has no wife!
    Thou shalt have none, Rousillon, none in France
    Then hast thou all again. Poor lord! is't
    That chase thee from thy country, and expose
    Those tender limbs of thine to the event
    Of the non-sparing war? And is it I
    That drive thee from the sportive court, where thou
    Wast shot at with fair eyes, to be the mark
    Of smoky muskets? O you leaden messengers,
    That ride upon the violent speed of fire,
    Fly with false aim; move the still-piecing air,
    That sings with piercing; do not touch my lord.
    Whoever shoots at him, I set him there;
    Whoever charges on his forward breast,
    I am the caitiff that do hold him to't;
    And though I kill him not, I am the cause
    His death was so effected. Better 'twere
    I met the ravin lion when he roar'd
    With sharp constraint of hunger; better 'twere
    That all the miseries which nature owes
    Were mine at once. No; come thou home, Rousillon,
    Whence honour but of danger wins a scar,
    As oft it loses all. I will be gone.
    My being here it is that holds thee hence.
    Shall I stay here to do 't? No, no, although
    The air of paradise did fan the house,
    And angels offic'd all. I will be gone,
    That pitiful rumour may report my flight
    To consolate thine ear. Come, night; end, day.
    For with the dark, poor thief, I'll steal away.         Exit
  DUKE. 
0
KE. The General of our Horse thou art; and we,
  BERTRAM. 
0
RTRAM. Sir, it is
  DUKE. 
0
KE. Then go thou forth;
  BERTRAM. 
0
RTRAM. This very day,
  BERTRAM. 
0
RTRAM. This very day,
    Great Mars, I put myself into thy file;
    Make me but like my thoughts, and I shall prove
    A lover of thy drum, hater of love.                   Exeunt
  COUNTESS. 
0
UNTESS. Alas! and would you take the letter of her?
  STEWARD. 
0
EWARD.  [Reads]  'I am Saint Jaques' pilgrim, thither gone.
  COUNTESS. 
0
UNTESS. Ah, what sharp stings are in her mildest words!
  STEWARD. 
0
EWARD. Pardon me, madam;
  COUNTESS. 
0
UNTESS. What angel shall
  COUNTESS. 
0
UNTESS. What angel shall
    Bless this unworthy husband? He cannot thrive,
    Unless her prayers, whom heaven delights to hear
    And loves to grant, reprieve him from the wrath
    Of greatest justice. Write, write, Rinaldo,
    To this unworthy husband of his wife;
    Let every word weigh heavy of her worth
    That he does weigh too light. My greatest grief,
    Though little he do feel it, set down sharply.
    Dispatch the most convenient messenger.
    When haply he shall hear that she is gone
    He will return; and hope I may that she,
    Hearing so much, will speed her foot again,
    Led hither by pure love. Which of them both
    Is dearest to me I have no skill in sense
    To make distinction. Provide this messenger.
    My heart is heavy, and mine age is weak;
    Grief would have tears, and sorrow bids me speak.     Exeunt
  WIDOW. 
0
DOW. Nay, come; for if they do approach the city we shall lose
  DIANA.

COND LORD. He must think us some band of strangers i' th'
    adversary's entertainment. Now he hath a smack of all
    neighbouring languages, therefore we must every one be a man of
    his own fancy; not to know what we speak one to another, so we
    seem to know, is to know straight our purpose: choughs' language,
    gabble enough, and good enough. As for you, interpreter, you must
    seem very politic. But couch, ho! here he comes; to beguile two

  DIANA. 
0
ANA. For which live long to thank both heaven and me!
    You may so in the end.
    My mother told me just how he would woo,
    As if she sat in's heart; she says all men
    Have the like oaths. He had sworn to marry me
    When his wife's dead; therefore I'll lie with him
    When I am buried. Since Frenchmen are so braid,
    Marry that will, I live and die a maid.
    Only, in this disguise, I think't no sin
    To cozen him that would unjustly win.                   Exit

ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
    'Twould burst at this. Captain I'll be no more;
    But I will eat, and drink, and sleep as soft
    As captain shall. Simply the thing I am
    Shall make me live. Who knows himself a braggart,
    Let him fear this; for it will come to pass
    That every braggart shall be found an ass.
    Rust, sword; cool, blushes; and, Parolles, live
    Safest in shame. Being fool'd, by fool'ry thrive.
    There's place and means for every man alive.
    I'll after them.                                        Exit
  HELENA.

    But with the word the time will bring on summer,
    When briers shall have leaves as well as thorns
    And be as sweet as sharp. We must away;
    Our waggon is prepar'd, and time revives us.
    All's Well that Ends Well. Still the fine's the crown.
    Whate'er the course, the end is the renown.           Exeunt

    The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,
    And he shall surety me. But for this lord
    Who hath abus'd me as he knows himself,
    Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him.
    He knows himself my bed he hath defil'd;
    And at that time he got his wife with child.
    Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick;
    So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick-
    And now behold the meaning.

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
    And these great tears grace his remembrance more
    Than those I shed for him. What was he like?
    I have forgot him; my imagination
    Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.
    I am undone; there is no living, none,
    If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one
    That I should love a bright particular star
    And think to wed it, he is so above me.
    In his bright radiance and collateral light
    Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.
    Th' ambition in my love thus plagues itself:
    The hind that would be mated by the lion
    Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though a plague,
    To see him every hour; to sit and draw
    His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,
    In our heart's table-heart too capable
    Of every line and trick of his sweet favour.
    But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy
    Must sanctify his relics. Who comes here?
  PAROLLES. 
1

  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
PAGE
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
    Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,
    Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,
    Might with effects of them follow our friends
    And show what we alone must think, which never
    Returns us thanks.

  HELENA. 
4
PAROLLES
KING
FRANCE
OF
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit
  KING. 
4
PAROLLES
KING
FRANCE
OF
NG. The Florentines and Senoys are by th' ears;
  FIRST 
4
PAROLLES
KING
FRANCE
OF
RST LORD. So 'tis reported, sir.
  KING.

  FIRST

KING
BERTRAM

FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. YOU have discharg'd this honestly; keep it to yourself.
    Many likelihoods inform'd me of this before, which hung so
    tott'ring in the balance that I could neither believe nor
    misdoubt. Pray you leave me. Stall this in your bosom; and I
    thank you for your honest care. I will speak with you further
    anon.                                           Exit STEWARD
  HELENA.

KING
BERTRAM
OF
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. Why, Helen, thou shalt have my leave and love,
    Means and attendants, and my loving greetings
    To those of mine in court. I'll stay at home,
    And pray God's blessing into thy attempt.
    Be gone to-morrow; and be sure of this,
    What I can help thee to thou shalt not miss.          Exeunt
  KING.

  KING. 
7
KING
OF
LAFEU
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Here is my hand; the premises observ'd,
    Thy will by my performance shall be serv'd.
    So make the choice of thy own time, for I,
    Thy resolv'd patient, on thee still rely.
    More should I question thee, and more I must,
    Though more to know could not be more to trust,
    From whence thou cam'st, how tended on. But rest
    Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.
    Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed
    As high as word, my deed shall match thy deed.
                                              [Flourish. Exeunt]
  COUNTESS.

    Sit, my preserver, by thy patient's side;
    And with this healthful hand, whose banish'd sense
    Thou has repeal'd, a second time receive
    The confirmation of my promis'd gift,
    Which but attends thy naming.
  HELENA.

KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Good fortune and the favour of the King
    Smile upon this contract; whose ceremony
    Shall seem expedient on the now-born brief,
    And be perform'd to-night. The solemn feast
    Shall more attend upon the coming space,
    Expecting absent friends. As thou lov'st her,
    Thy love's to me religious; else, does err.
              Exeunt all but LAFEU and PAROLLES who stay behind,
  LAFEU.

FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Well, thou hast a son shall take this disgrace off me:
    scurvy, old, filthy, scurvy lord! Well, I must be patient; there
    is no fettering of authority. I'll beat him, by my life, if I can
    meet him with any convenience, an he were double and double a
    lord. I'll have no more pity of his age than I would have of-
    I'll beat him, and if I could but meet him again.
  LAFEU.

  LAFEU.

KING

BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
FEU. Go to, sir; you were beaten in Italy for picking a kernel
    out of a pomegranate; you are a vagabond, and no true traveller;
    you are more saucy with lords and honourable personages than the
    commission of your birth and virtue gives you heraldry. You are
    not worth another word, else I'd call you knave. I leave you.
  PAROLLES. 
9
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA

  BERTRAM.

    The King has done you wrong; but, hush, 'tis so.      Exeunt

    When better fall, for your avails they fell.
    To-morrow to th' field. Flourish.                     Exeunt

  COUNTESS. 
11
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
COUNTESS
UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
    recovered the King and undone me. I have wedded her, not bedded
    her; and sworn to make the "not" eternal. You shall hear I am run
    away; know it before the report come. If there be breadth enough
    in the world, I will hold a long distance. My duty to you.
                                           Your unfortunate son,
                                                       BERTRAM.'
    This is not well, rash and unbridled boy,
    To fly the favours of so good a king,
    To pluck his indignation on thy head
    By the misprizing of a maid too virtuous
    For the contempt of empire.
  CLOWN. 
11
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF

FRANCE

OWN. So say I, madam, if he run away, as I hear he does the
    danger is in standing to 't; that's the loss of men, though it be
    the getting of children. Here they come will tell you more. For my
    part, I only hear your son was run away.                Exit
  SECOND

11
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM

  HELENA. 
11
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
    Nothing in France until he has no wife!
    Thou shalt have none, Rousillon, none in France
    Then hast thou all again. Poor lord! is't
    That chase thee from thy country, and expose
    Those tender limbs of thine to the event
    Of the non-sparing war? And is it I
    That drive thee from the sportive court, where thou
    Wast shot at with fair eyes, to be the mark
    Of smoky muskets? O you leaden messengers,
    That ride upon the violent speed of fire,
    Fly with false aim; move the still-piecing air,
    That sings with piercing; do not touch my lord.
    Whoever shoots at him, I set him there;
    Whoever charges on his forward breast,
    I am the caitiff that do hold him to't;
    And though I kill him not, I am the cause
    His death was so effected. Better 'twere
    I met the ravin lion when he roar'd
    With sharp constraint of hunger; better 'twere
    That all the miseries which nature owes
    Were mine at once. No; come thou home, Rousillon,
    Whence honour but of danger wins a scar,
    As oft it loses all. I will be gone.
    My being here it is that holds thee hence.
    Shall I stay here to do 't? No, no, although
    The air of paradise did fan the house,
    And angels offic'd all. I will be gone,
    That pitiful rumour may report my flight
    To consolate thine ear. Come, night; end, day.
    For with the dark, poor thief, I'll steal away.         Exit
  DUKE. 
11
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA

PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
KE. The General of our Horse thou art; and we,

    Great Mars, I put myself into thy file;
    Make me but like my thoughts, and I shall prove
    A lover of thy drum, hater of love.                   Exeunt

  COUNTESS. 
13
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
COUNTESS
WIDOW
UNTESS. What angel shall
    Bless this unworthy husband? He cannot thrive,
    Unless her prayers, whom heaven delights to hear
    And loves to grant, reprieve him from the wrath
    Of greatest justice. Write, write, Rinaldo,
    To this unworthy husband of his wife;
    Let every word weigh heavy of her worth
    That he does weigh too light. My greatest grief,
    Though little he do feel it, set down sharply.
    Dispatch the most convenient messenger.
    When haply he shall hear that she is gone
    He will return; and hope I may that she,
    Hearing so much, will speed her foot again,
    Led hither by pure love. Which of them both
    Is dearest to me I have no skill in sense
    To make distinction. Provide this messenger.
    My heart is heavy, and mine age is weak;
    Grief would have tears, and sorrow bids me speak.     Exeunt
  WIDOW. 
13
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF

WIDOW

WIDOW
LENA. I humbly thank you.
    Please it this matron and this gentle maid
    To eat with us to-night; the charge and thanking
    Shall be for me, and, to requite you further,
    I will bestow some precepts of this virgin,
    Worthy the note.
    BOTH. We'll take your offer kindly.                   Exeunt
  SECOND

RST LORD. O, for the love of laughter, let him fetch his drum; he
    says he has a stratagem for't. When your lordship sees the bottom
    of his success in't, and to what metal this counterfeit lump of
    ore will be melted, if you give him not John Drum's
    entertainment, your inclining cannot be removed. Here he comes.

OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. Why then to-night
    Let us assay our plot; which, if it speed,
    Is wicked meaning in a lawful deed,
    And lawful meaning in a lawful act;
    Where both not sin, and yet a sinful fact.
    But let's about it.                                   Exeunt
  SECOND

  SECOND 
16
KING

BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
COND LORD. He must think us some band of strangers i' th'
    adversary's entertainment. Now he hath a smack of all
    neighbouring languages, therefore we must every one be a man of
    his own fancy; not to know what we speak one to another, so we
    seem to know, is to know straight our purpose: choughs' language,
    gabble enough, and good enough. As for you, interpreter, you must
    seem very politic. But couch, ho! here he comes; to beguile two
    hours in a sleep, and then to return and swear the lies he forges.
  PAROLLES.

16
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ANA. For which live long to thank both heaven and me!
  DIANA. 
16
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ANA. For which live long to thank both heaven and me!
    You may so in the end.
    My mother told me just how he would woo,
    As if she sat in's heart; she says all men
    Have the like oaths. He had sworn to marry me
    When his wife's dead; therefore I'll lie with him
    When I am buried. Since Frenchmen are so braid,
    Marry that will, I live and die a maid.
    Only, in this disguise, I think't no sin
    To cozen him that would unjustly win.                   Exit
  SECOND

COND LORD. The web of our life is of a mingled yarn, good and ill
    together. Our virtues would be proud if our faults whipt them
    not; and our crimes would despair if they were not cherish'd by
    our virtues.
  SERVANT.

16
KING
LORDS
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
COND LORD. Good Captain, will you give me a copy of the sonnet
    you writ to Diana in behalf of the Count Rousillon? An I were not
    a very coward I'd compel it of you; but fare you well.
                                        Exeunt BERTRAM and LORDS
  FIRST

RST SOLDIER. If you could find out a country where but women were
  FIRST 
16
KING
LORDS
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
RST SOLDIER. If you could find out a country where but women were
    that had received so much shame, you might begin an impudent
    nation. Fare ye well, sir; I am for France too; we shall speak of
    you there.                                Exit with SOLDIERS
  PAROLLES. 
16
KING
LORDS
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
  PAROLLES. 
16
KING
LORDS
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
    'Twould burst at this. Captain I'll be no more;
    But I will eat, and drink, and sleep as soft
    As captain shall. Simply the thing I am
    Shall make me live. Who knows himself a braggart,
    Let him fear this; for it will come to pass
    That every braggart shall be found an ass.
    Rust, sword; cool, blushes; and, Parolles, live
    Safest in shame. Being fool'd, by fool'ry thrive.
    There's place and means for every man alive.
    I'll after them.                                        Exit
  HELENA. 
16
KING
LORDS
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. That you may well perceive I have not wrong'd you!
  WIDOW. 
16
KING
LORDS
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND

FLORENCE

COUNTESS

DOW. Gentle madam,
  HELENA.

LENA. Nor you, mistress,
  DIANA.

  HELENA.

HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. Yet, I pray you:
    But with the word the time will bring on summer,
    When briers shall have leaves as well as thorns
    And be as sweet as sharp. We must away;
    Our waggon is prepar'd, and time revives us.
    All's Well that Ends Well. Still the fine's the crown.
    Whate'er the course, the end is the renown.           Exeunt
  LAFEU.

LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. But this exceeding posting day and night
    Must wear your spirits low; we cannot help it.
    But since you have made the days and nights as one,
    To wear your gentle limbs in my affairs,
    Be bold you do so grow in my requital
    As nothing can unroot you.
  GENTLEMAN.

HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
GENTLEMAN
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ROLLES. I praise God for you.                         Exeunt
  KING. 
17

NG. We lost a jewel of her, and our esteem
  COUNTESS.

  KING.

NG. Then shall we have a match. I have letters sent me
    That sets him high in fame.

18
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
GENTLEMAN
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
NG. The heavens have thought well on thee, Lafeu,
    To bring forth this discov'ry. Seek these suitors.
    Go speedily, and bring again the Count.
                                               Exeunt ATTENDANTS
  COUNTESS. 
18
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
GENTLEMAN
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
UNTESS. Now, justice on the doers!
  KING. 
18
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
GENTLEMAN
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
NG. I wonder, sir, sith wives are monsters to you.
  KING. 
18
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
GENTLEMAN
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
NG. I wonder, sir, sith wives are monsters to you.
    And that you fly them as you swear them lordship,
    Yet you desire to marry.
  DIANA. 
18
KING
LORDS

OF

ANA. I am, my lord, a wretched Florentine,
  WIDOW.

  KING.

WIDOW
ANA. Good mother, fetch my bail. Stay, royal sir;
                                                      Exit WIDOW
    The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,
    And he shall surety me. But for this lord
    Who hath abus'd me as he knows himself,
    Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him.
    He knows himself my bed he hath defil'd;
    And at that time he got his wife with child.
    Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick;
    So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick-
    And now behold the meaning.
  KING.

  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
    And these great tears grace his remembrance more
    Than those I shed for him. What was he like?
    I have forgot him; my imagination
    Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.
    I am undone; there is no living, none,
    If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one
    That I should love a bright particular star
    And think to wed it, he is so above me.
    In his bright radiance and collateral light
    Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.
    Th' ambition in my love thus plagues itself:
    The hind that would be mated by the lion
    Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though a plague,
    To see him every hour; to sit and draw
    His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,
    In our heart's table-heart too capable
    Of every line and trick of his sweet favour.
    But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy
    Must sanctify his relics. Who comes here?
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Save you, fair queen!
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. And you, monarch!
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. No.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. And no.
  PAROLLES.

PAROLLES

PAROLLES

  HELENA.

PAROLLES

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA.

PAROLLES

  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Not my virginity yet.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. That I wish well. 'Tis pity-
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. What's pity?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
PAGE
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
    Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,
    Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,
    Might with effects of them follow our friends
    And show what we alone must think, which never
    Returns us thanks.
  PAGE. 
1
PAROLLES
GE. Monsieur Parolles, my lord calls for you.      Exit PAGE
  PAROLLES.

PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES

  PAROLLES.

PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. I especially think, under Mars.
  PAROLLES.

PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. The wars hath so kept you under that you must needs be born
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. When he was predominant.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. When he was retrograde, I think, rather.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Why think you so?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. You go so much backward when you fight.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. That's for advantage.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. So is running away, when fear proposes the safety: but the
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. I am so full of business I cannot answer thee acutely. I
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
  HELENA. 
4
PAROLLES
KING
FRANCE
OF
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit
  KING. 
4
PAROLLES
KING
FRANCE
OF

KING
BERTRAM

FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. YOU have discharg'd this honestly; keep it to yourself.
    Many likelihoods inform'd me of this before, which hung so
    tott'ring in the balance that I could neither believe nor
    misdoubt. Pray you leave me. Stall this in your bosom; and I
    thank you for your honest care. I will speak with you further
    anon.                                           Exit STEWARD
  HELENA.

7
KING
BERTRAM
OF
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. Why, Helen, thou shalt have my leave and love,
    Means and attendants, and my loving greetings
    To those of mine in court. I'll stay at home,
    And pray God's blessing into thy attempt.
    Be gone to-morrow; and be sure of this,
    What I can help thee to thou shalt not miss.          Exeunt
  KING.

  KING. 
7
KING
OF
LAFEU
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Here is my hand; the premises observ'd,
    Thy will by my performance shall be serv'd.
    So make the choice of thy own time, for I,
    Thy resolv'd patient, on thee still rely.
    More should I question thee, and more I must,
    Though more to know could not be more to trust,
    From whence thou cam'st, how tended on. But rest
    Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.
    Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed
    As high as word, my deed shall match thy deed.
                                              [Flourish. Exeunt]
  COUNTESS.

  COUNTESS.

    Sit, my preserver, by thy patient's side;
    And with this healthful hand, whose banish'd sense
    Thou has repeal'd, a second time receive
    The confirmation of my promis'd gift,
    Which but attends thy naming.
  HELENA.

KING

BERTRAM
OF
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Good fortune and the favour of the King
    Smile upon this contract; whose ceremony
    Shall seem expedient on the now-born brief,
    And be perform'd to-night. The solemn feast
    Shall more attend upon the coming space,
    Expecting absent friends. As thou lov'st her,
    Thy love's to me religious; else, does err.
              Exeunt all but LAFEU and PAROLLES who stay behind,
  LAFEU.

LAFEU
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Well, thou hast a son shall take this disgrace off me:
    scurvy, old, filthy, scurvy lord! Well, I must be patient; there
    is no fettering of authority. I'll beat him, by my life, if I can
    meet him with any convenience, an he were double and double a
    lord. I'll have no more pity of his age than I would have of-
    I'll beat him, and if I could but meet him again.
  LAFEU.

  LAFEU.

KING

BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
FEU. Go to, sir; you were beaten in Italy for picking a kernel
    out of a pomegranate; you are a vagabond, and no true traveller;
    you are more saucy with lords and honourable personages than the
    commission of your birth and virtue gives you heraldry. You are
    not worth another word, else I'd call you knave. I leave you.
  PAROLLES. 
9

LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU

  BERTRAM.

FRANCE

HELENA

KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Why, these balls bound; there's noise in it. 'Tis hard:
  PAROLLES. 
9
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
FRANCE
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Why, these balls bound; there's noise in it. 'Tis hard:
    A young man married is a man that's marr'd.
    Therefore away, and leave her bravely; go.
    The King has done you wrong; but, hush, 'tis so.      Exeunt
  HELENA. 
9
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF

  HELENA.

    make us friends; I will pursue the amity
  PAROLLES.

COUNTESS
KE. Welcome shall they be
    And all the honours that can fly from us
    Shall on them settle. You know your places well;
    When better fall, for your avails they fell.
    To-morrow to th' field. Flourish.                     Exeunt
  COUNTESS.

COUNTESS
UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
  COUNTESS. 
11
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
COUNTESS
UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
    recovered the King and undone me. I have wedded her, not bedded
    her; and sworn to make the "not" eternal. You shall hear I am run
    away; know it before the report come. If there be breadth enough
    in the world, I will hold a long distance. My duty to you.
                                           Your unfortunate son,
                                                       BERTRAM.'
    This is not well, rash and unbridled boy,
    To fly the favours of so good a king,
    To pluck his indignation on thy head
    By the misprizing of a maid too virtuous
    For the contempt of empire.
  CLOWN. 
11
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF

FLORENCE
COUNTESS
OWN. So say I, madam, if he run away, as I hear he does the
    danger is in standing to 't; that's the loss of men, though it be
    the getting of children. Here they come will tell you more. For my
    part, I only hear your son was run away.                Exit
  SECOND

11
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM

  HELENA. 
11
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
    Nothing in France until he has no wife!
    Thou shalt have none, Rousillon, none in France
    Then hast thou all again. Poor lord! is't
    That chase thee from thy country, and expose
    Those tender limbs of thine to the event
    Of the non-sparing war? And is it I
    That drive thee from the sportive court, where thou
    Wast shot at with fair eyes, to be the mark
    Of smoky muskets? O you leaden messengers,
    That ride upon the violent speed of fire,
    Fly with false aim; move the still-piecing air,
    That sings with piercing; do not touch my lord.
    Whoever shoots at him, I set him there;
    Whoever charges on his forward breast,
    I am the caitiff that do hold him to't;
    And though I kill him not, I am the cause
    His death was so effected. Better 'twere
    I met the ravin lion when he roar'd
    With sharp constraint of hunger; better 'twere
    That all the miseries which nature owes
    Were mine at once. No; come thou home, Rousillon,
    Whence honour but of danger wins a scar,
    As oft it loses all. I will be gone.
    My being here it is that holds thee hence.
    Shall I stay here to do 't? No, no, although
    The air of paradise did fan the house,
    And angels offic'd all. I will be gone,
    That pitiful rumour may report my flight
    To consolate thine ear. Come, night; end, day.
    For with the dark, poor thief, I'll steal away.         Exit
  DUKE. 
11
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA

PAROLLES

KE. The General of our Horse thou art; and we,
  BERTRAM.

    A lover of thy drum, hater of love.                   Exeunt

  COUNTESS. 
13
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
COUNTESS
WIDOW
UNTESS. What angel shall
    Bless this unworthy husband? He cannot thrive,
    Unless her prayers, whom heaven delights to hear
    And loves to grant, reprieve him from the wrath
    Of greatest justice. Write, write, Rinaldo,
    To this unworthy husband of his wife;
    Let every word weigh heavy of her worth
    That he does weigh too light. My greatest grief,
    Though little he do feel it, set down sharply.
    Dispatch the most convenient messenger.
    When haply he shall hear that she is gone
    He will return; and hope I may that she,
    Hearing so much, will speed her foot again,
    Led hither by pure love. Which of them both
    Is dearest to me I have no skill in sense
    To make distinction. Provide this messenger.
    My heart is heavy, and mine age is weak;
    Grief would have tears, and sorrow bids me speak.     Exeunt
  WIDOW. 
13
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM

LENA. I humbly thank you.
    Please it this matron and this gentle maid
    To eat with us to-night; the charge and thanking
    Shall be for me, and, to requite you further,
    I will bestow some precepts of this virgin,
    Worthy the note.
    BOTH. We'll take your offer kindly.                   Exeunt
  SECOND

WIDOW

    says he has a stratagem for't. When your lordship sees the bottom
    of his success in't, and to what metal this counterfeit lump of
    ore will be melted, if you give him not John Drum's
    entertainment, your inclining cannot be removed. Here he comes.
  SECOND

FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. Why then to-night
    Let us assay our plot; which, if it speed,
    Is wicked meaning in a lawful deed,
    And lawful meaning in a lawful act;
    Where both not sin, and yet a sinful fact.
    But let's about it.                                   Exeunt
  SECOND

WIDOW
COND LORD. He must think us some band of strangers i' th'
    adversary's entertainment. Now he hath a smack of all
    neighbouring languages, therefore we must every one be a man of
    his own fancy; not to know what we speak one to another, so we
    seem to know, is to know straight our purpose: choughs' language,
    gabble enough, and good enough. As for you, interpreter, you must
    seem very politic. But couch, ho! here he comes; to beguile two
    hours in a sleep, and then to return and swear the lies he forges.
  PAROLLES.

OF
LAFEU

  DIANA. 
16
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ANA. For which live long to thank both heaven and me!
    You may so in the end.
    My mother told me just how he would woo,
    As if she sat in's heart; she says all men
    Have the like oaths. He had sworn to marry me
    When his wife's dead; therefore I'll lie with him
    When I am buried. Since Frenchmen are so braid,
    Marry that will, I live and die a maid.
    Only, in this disguise, I think't no sin
    To cozen him that would unjustly win.                   Exit
  SECOND

  PAROLLES. 
16
KING
LORDS
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
  PAROLLES. 
16
KING
LORDS
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
    'Twould burst at this. Captain I'll be no more;
    But I will eat, and drink, and sleep as soft
    As captain shall. Simply the thing I am
    Shall make me live. Who knows himself a braggart,
    Let him fear this; for it will come to pass
    That every braggart shall be found an ass.
    Rust, sword; cool, blushes; and, Parolles, live
    Safest in shame. Being fool'd, by fool'ry thrive.
    There's place and means for every man alive.
    I'll after them.                                        Exit
  HELENA.

LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. Yet, I pray you:
    But with the word the time will bring on summer,
    When briers shall have leaves as well as thorns
    And be as sweet as sharp. We must away;
    Our waggon is prepar'd, and time revives us.
    All's Well that Ends Well. Still the fine's the crown.
    Whate'er the course, the end is the renown.           Exeunt
  LAFEU.

17
KING
LORDS
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
GENTLEMAN
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. But this exceeding posting day and night
    Must wear your spirits low; we cannot help it.
    But since you have made the days and nights as one,
    To wear your gentle limbs in my affairs,
    Be bold you do so grow in my requital
    As nothing can unroot you.
  GENTLEMAN.

WIDOW
NG. Then shall we have a match. I have letters sent me
  KING.

NG. Then shall we have a match. I have letters sent me
    That sets him high in fame.
  LAFEU.

18
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
GENTLEMAN
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
NG. The heavens have thought well on thee, Lafeu,
    To bring forth this discov'ry. Seek these suitors.
    Go speedily, and bring again the Count.
                                               Exeunt ATTENDANTS
  COUNTESS. 
18
KING
LORDS

OF

WIDOW
UNTESS. Now, justice on the doers!

KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF

MESSENGER
FRENCH
GENTLEMAN
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
NG. I wonder, sir, sith wives are monsters to you.
  KING. 
18
KING
LORDS
BERTRAM
OF
LAFEU
HELENA
SECOND
CLOWN
FRANCE
PAROLLES
DUKE
FLORENCE
MESSENGER
FRENCH
GENTLEMAN
LORD
COUNTESS
WIDOW
NG. I wonder, sir, sith wives are monsters to you.
    And that you fly them as you swear them lordship,
    Yet you desire to marry.
  DIANA. 
18

                                                      Exit WIDOW
    The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,
    And he shall surety me. But for this lord
    Who hath abus'd me as he knows himself,
    Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him.
    He knows himself my bed he hath defil'd;
    And at that time he got his wife with child.
    Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick;
    So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick-
    And now behold the meaning.
  KING.

  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
    And these great tears grace his remembrance more
    Than those I shed for him. What was he like?
    I have forgot him; my imagination
    Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.
    I am undone; there is no living, none,
    If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one
    That I should love a bright particular star
    And think to wed it, he is so above me.
    In his bright radiance and collateral light
    Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.
    Th' ambition in my love thus plagues itself:
    The hind that would be mated by the lion
    Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though a plague,
    To see him every hour; to sit and draw
    His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,
    In our heart's table-heart too capable
    Of every line and trick of his sweet favour.
    But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy
    Must sanctify his relics. Who comes here?
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Save you, fair queen!
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. And you, monarch!
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. No.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. And no.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES

1
PAROLLES

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA.

PAROLLES

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA.

  PAROLLES. 
1

  HELENA.

PAROLLES

  PAROLLES. 
1

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES

  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
PAGE
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
    Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,
    Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,
    Might with effects of them follow our friends
    And show what we alone must think, which never
    Returns us thanks.
  PAGE. 
1
PAROLLES
GE. Monsieur Parolles, my lord calls for you.      Exit PAGE
  PAROLLES.

PAROLLES

  HELENA.

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. I especially think, under Mars.
  PAROLLES.

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. The wars hath so kept you under that you must needs be born
  PAROLLES. 
1

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES

  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Why think you so?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. You go so much backward when you fight.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. That's for advantage.
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. So is running away, when fear proposes the safety: but the
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. I am so full of business I cannot answer thee acutely. I
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
KING
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit
  KING. 
2
PAROLLES
KING
NG. The Florentines and Senoys are by th' ears;

HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. YOU have discharg'd this honestly; keep it to yourself.
    Many likelihoods inform'd me of this before, which hung so
    tott'ring in the balance that I could neither believe nor
    misdoubt. Pray you leave me. Stall this in your bosom; and I
    thank you for your honest care. I will speak with you further
    anon.                                           Exit STEWARD

KING

HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. Why, Helen, thou shalt have my leave and love,
    Means and attendants, and my loving greetings
    To those of mine in court. I'll stay at home,
    And pray God's blessing into thy attempt.
    Be gone to-morrow; and be sure of this,
    What I can help thee to thou shalt not miss.          Exeunt

  KING.

KING
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Here is my hand; the premises observ'd,
    Thy will by my performance shall be serv'd.
    So make the choice of thy own time, for I,
    Thy resolv'd patient, on thee still rely.
    More should I question thee, and more I must,
    Though more to know could not be more to trust,
    From whence thou cam'st, how tended on. But rest
    Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.
    Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed
    As high as word, my deed shall match thy deed.
                                              [Flourish. Exeunt]

    Sit, my preserver, by thy patient's side;
    And with this healthful hand, whose banish'd sense
    Thou has repeal'd, a second time receive
    The confirmation of my promis'd gift,
    Which but attends thy naming.

COUNTESS
NG. Good fortune and the favour of the King
    Smile upon this contract; whose ceremony
    Shall seem expedient on the now-born brief,
    And be perform'd to-night. The solemn feast
    Shall more attend upon the coming space,
    Expecting absent friends. As thou lov'st her,
    Thy love's to me religious; else, does err.
              Exeunt all but LAFEU and PAROLLES who stay behind,
  LAFEU.

ROLLES. Well, thou hast a son shall take this disgrace off me:
    scurvy, old, filthy, scurvy lord! Well, I must be patient; there
    is no fettering of authority. I'll beat him, by my life, if I can
    meet him with any convenience, an he were double and double a
    lord. I'll have no more pity of his age than I would have of-
    I'll beat him, and if I could but meet him again.

FEU. Go to, sir; you were beaten in Italy for picking a kernel
    out of a pomegranate; you are a vagabond, and no true traveller;
    you are more saucy with lords and honourable personages than the
    commission of your birth and virtue gives you heraldry. You are
    not worth another word, else I'd call you knave. I leave you.
  PAROLLES.

KE. Welcome shall they be

    When better fall, for your avails they fell.
    To-morrow to th' field. Flourish.                     Exeunt

  COUNTESS. 
7
KING
DUKE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
COUNTESS
UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
    recovered the King and undone me. I have wedded her, not bedded
    her; and sworn to make the "not" eternal. You shall hear I am run
    away; know it before the report come. If there be breadth enough
    in the world, I will hold a long distance. My duty to you.
                                           Your unfortunate son,
                                                       BERTRAM.'
    This is not well, rash and unbridled boy,
    To fly the favours of so good a king,
    To pluck his indignation on thy head
    By the misprizing of a maid too virtuous
    For the contempt of empire.
  CLOWN.

LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
  HELENA. 
7
KING
DUKE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
LENA. 'Till I have no wife, I have nothing in France.'
    Nothing in France until he has no wife!
    Thou shalt have none, Rousillon, none in France
    Then hast thou all again. Poor lord! is't
    That chase thee from thy country, and expose
    Those tender limbs of thine to the event
    Of the non-sparing war? And is it I
    That drive thee from the sportive court, where thou
    Wast shot at with fair eyes, to be the mark
    Of smoky muskets? O you leaden messengers,
    That ride upon the violent speed of fire,
    Fly with false aim; move the still-piecing air,
    That sings with piercing; do not touch my lord.
    Whoever shoots at him, I set him there;
    Whoever charges on his forward breast,
    I am the caitiff that do hold him to't;
    And though I kill him not, I am the cause
    His death was so effected. Better 'twere
    I met the ravin lion when he roar'd
    With sharp constraint of hunger; better 'twere
    That all the miseries which nature owes
    Were mine at once. No; come thou home, Rousillon,
    Whence honour but of danger wins a scar,
    As oft it loses all. I will be gone.
    My being here it is that holds thee hence.
    Shall I stay here to do 't? No, no, although
    The air of paradise did fan the house,
    And angels offic'd all. I will be gone,
    That pitiful rumour may report my flight
    To consolate thine ear. Come, night; end, day.
    For with the dark, poor thief, I'll steal away.         Exit
  DUKE. 
7
KING
DUKE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN

    A lover of thy drum, hater of love.                   Exeunt

  COUNTESS. 
9
KING
DUKE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
UNTESS. What angel shall
    Bless this unworthy husband? He cannot thrive,
    Unless her prayers, whom heaven delights to hear
    And loves to grant, reprieve him from the wrath
    Of greatest justice. Write, write, Rinaldo,
    To this unworthy husband of his wife;
    Let every word weigh heavy of her worth
    That he does weigh too light. My greatest grief,
    Though little he do feel it, set down sharply.
    Dispatch the most convenient messenger.
    When haply he shall hear that she is gone
    He will return; and hope I may that she,
    Hearing so much, will speed her foot again,
    Led hither by pure love. Which of them both
    Is dearest to me I have no skill in sense
    To make distinction. Provide this messenger.
    My heart is heavy, and mine age is weak;
    Grief would have tears, and sorrow bids me speak.     Exeunt
  WIDOW.

CLOWN

HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. I humbly thank you.
    Please it this matron and this gentle maid
    To eat with us to-night; the charge and thanking
    Shall be for me, and, to requite you further,
    I will bestow some precepts of this virgin,
    Worthy the note.
    BOTH. We'll take your offer kindly.                   Exeunt
  SECOND

COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. Why then to-night
    Let us assay our plot; which, if it speed,
    Is wicked meaning in a lawful deed,
    And lawful meaning in a lawful act;
    Where both not sin, and yet a sinful fact.
    But let's about it.                                   Exeunt

  SECOND

KING

LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
COND LORD. He must think us some band of strangers i' th'
    adversary's entertainment. Now he hath a smack of all
    neighbouring languages, therefore we must every one be a man of
    his own fancy; not to know what we speak one to another, so we
    seem to know, is to know straight our purpose: choughs' language,
    gabble enough, and good enough. As for you, interpreter, you must
    seem very politic. But couch, ho! here he comes; to beguile two
    hours in a sleep, and then to return and swear the lies he forges.
  PAROLLES.

  DIANA. 
9
KING
DUKE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ANA. For which live long to thank both heaven and me!
    You may so in the end.
    My mother told me just how he would woo,
    As if she sat in's heart; she says all men
    Have the like oaths. He had sworn to marry me
    When his wife's dead; therefore I'll lie with him
    When I am buried. Since Frenchmen are so braid,
    Marry that will, I live and die a maid.
    Only, in this disguise, I think't no sin
    To cozen him that would unjustly win.                   Exit
  SECOND

RST SOLDIER. What's he?
  PAROLLES.

  FIRST

  PAROLLES.

PAROLLES

  FIRST

  PAROLLES.

  FIRST

  SECOND

  SECOND 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
COND LORD. Good Captain, will you give me a copy of the sonnet
    you writ to Diana in behalf of the Count Rousillon? An I were not
    a very coward I'd compel it of you; but fare you well.
                                        Exeunt BERTRAM and LORDS
  FIRST 
8
KING

LAFEU

HELENA

WIDOW
RST SOLDIER. You are undone, Captain, all but your scarf; that
  PAROLLES.

KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN

HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ROLLES. Who cannot be crush'd with a plot?
  FIRST 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
RST SOLDIER. If you could find out a country where but women were
  FIRST 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
RST SOLDIER. If you could find out a country where but women were
    that had received so much shame, you might begin an impudent
    nation. Fare ye well, sir; I am for France too; we shall speak of
    you there.                                Exit with SOLDIERS
  PAROLLES. 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
  PAROLLES. 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
ROLLES. Yet am I thankful. If my heart were great,
    'Twould burst at this. Captain I'll be no more;
    But I will eat, and drink, and sleep as soft
    As captain shall. Simply the thing I am
    Shall make me live. Who knows himself a braggart,
    Let him fear this; for it will come to pass
    That every braggart shall be found an ass.
    Rust, sword; cool, blushes; and, Parolles, live
    Safest in shame. Being fool'd, by fool'ry thrive.
    There's place and means for every man alive.
    I'll after them.                                        Exit
  HELENA. 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. That you may well perceive I have not wrong'd you!
  WIDOW. 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
DOW. Gentle madam,
  HELENA. 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. Nor you, mistress,
  DIANA. 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA

WIDOW
ANA. Let death and honesty
  HELENA. 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. Yet, I pray you:
  HELENA. 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. Yet, I pray you:
    But with the word the time will bring on summer,
    When briers shall have leaves as well as thorns
    And be as sweet as sharp. We must away;
    Our waggon is prepar'd, and time revives us.
    All's Well that Ends Well. Still the fine's the crown.
    Whate'er the course, the end is the renown.           Exeunt
  LAFEU. 
8
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
FEU. No, no, no, son was misled with a snipt-taffeta fellow
  COUNTESS.

  LAFEU.

HELENA

WIDOW

  CLOWN. 
8

DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW

  LAFEU.

WIDOW

  CLOWN.

  LAFEU.

  CLOWN.

DUKE
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW

  LAFEU.

  CLOWN.

  HELENA. 
9
KING
DUKE
LAFEU
GENTLEMAN
CLOWN
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
WIDOW
LENA. But this exceeding posting day and night
    Must wear your spirits low; we cannot help it.
    But since you have made the days and nights as one,
    To wear your gentle limbs in my affairs,
    Be bold you do so grow in my requital
    As nothing can unroot you.
  GENTLEMAN. 
9

DUKE

COUNTESS
WIDOW
ANA. Good mother, fetch my bail. Stay, royal sir;
                                                      Exit WIDOW
    The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,
    And he shall surety me. But for this lord
    Who hath abus'd me as he knows himself,
    Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him.
    He knows himself my bed he hath defil'd;
    And at that time he got his wife with child.
    Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick;
    So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick-
    And now behold the meaning.
  KING. 
10
KING

NG OF FRANCE

  LAFEU,

  PAROLLES,

  TWO 
0
O FRENCH LORDS, serving with Bertram
  STEWARD, 
0
EWARD, Servant to the Countess of Rousillon
  LAVACHE, 
0
VACHE, a clown and Servant to the Countess of Rousillon
  COUNTESS 
0
UNTESS OF ROUSILLON, mother to Bertram
  HELENA, 
0
LENA, a gentlewoman protected by the Countess
  DIANA, 
0
ANA, daughter to the Widow
  VIOLENTA, 
0
OLENTA, neighbour and friend to the Widow
  MARIANA, 
1
BERTRAM
RIANA, neighbour and friend to the Widow
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. In delivering my son from me, I bury a second husband.
  BERTRAM. 
1
BERTRAM
RTRAM. And I in going, madam, weep o'er my father's death anew;
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. You shall find of the King a husband, madam; you, sir, a
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. What hope is there of his Majesty's amendment?
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He hath abandon'd his physicians, madam; under whose
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. This young gentlewoman had a father- O, that 'had,' how
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. How call'd you the man you speak of, madam?
  COUNTESS. 
1
BERTRAM
UNTESS. He was famous, sir, in his profession, and it was his
  LAFEU. 
1
BERTRAM
FEU. He was excellent indeed, madam; the King very lately spoke
  BERTRAM.

BERTRAM

  COUNTESS.

  LAFEU.

  HELENA. 
0
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. O, were that all! I think not on my father;
    And these great tears grace his remembrance more
    Than those I shed for him. What was he like?
    I have forgot him; my imagination
    Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.
    I am undone; there is no living, none,
    If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one
    That I should love a bright particular star
    And think to wed it, he is so above me.
    In his bright radiance and collateral light
    Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.
    Th' ambition in my love thus plagues itself:
    The hind that would be mated by the lion
    Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though a plague,
    To see him every hour; to sit and draw
    His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,
    In our heart's table-heart too capable
    Of every line and trick of his sweet favour.
    But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy
    Must sanctify his relics. Who comes here?
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. Save you, fair queen!
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. And you, monarch!
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. No.
  HELENA.

  PAROLLES.

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA.

  HELENA.

  PAROLLES.

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA.

PAROLLES

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES

  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. What's pity?
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
PAGE
LENA. That wishing well had not a body in't
    Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,
    Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,
    Might with effects of them follow our friends
    And show what we alone must think, which never
    Returns us thanks.
  PAGE.

  HELENA.

  PAROLLES.

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. You go so much backward when you fight.
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES

  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. So is running away, when fear proposes the safety: but the
  PAROLLES. 
1
PAROLLES
ROLLES. I am so full of business I cannot answer thee acutely. I
  HELENA. 
1
PAROLLES
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
  HELENA. 
2
PAROLLES
KING
LENA. Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,
    Which we ascribe to heaven. The fated sky
    Gives us free scope; only doth backward pull
    Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.
    What power is it which mounts my love so high,
    That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?
    The mightiest space in fortune nature brings
    To join like likes, and kiss like native things.
    Impossible be strange attempts to those
    That weigh their pains in sense, and do suppose
    What hath been cannot be. Who ever strove
    To show her merit that did miss her love?
    The King's disease-my project may deceive me,
    But my intents are fix'd, and will not leave me.        Exit
  KING.

COUNTESS
UNTESS. YOU have discharg'd this honestly; keep it to yourself.
    Many likelihoods inform'd me of this before, which hung so
    tott'ring in the balance that I could neither believe nor
    misdoubt. Pray you leave me. Stall this in your bosom; and I
    thank you for your honest care. I will speak with you further
    anon.                                           Exit STEWARD

HELENA
COUNTESS
UNTESS. Why, Helen, thou shalt have my leave and love,
    Means and attendants, and my loving greetings
    To those of mine in court. I'll stay at home,
    And pray God's blessing into thy attempt.
    Be gone to-morrow; and be sure of this,
    What I can help thee to thou shalt not miss.          Exeunt

KING

HELENA
COUNTESS

  KING. 
5
KING
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Here is my hand; the premises observ'd,
    Thy will by my performance shall be serv'd.
    So make the choice of thy own time, for I,
    Thy resolv'd patient, on thee still rely.
    More should I question thee, and more I must,
    Though more to know could not be more to trust,
    From whence thou cam'st, how tended on. But rest
    Unquestion'd welcome and undoubted blest.
    Give me some help here, ho! If thou proceed
    As high as word, my deed shall match thy deed.
                                              [Flourish. Exeunt]
  COUNTESS.

KING

PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
NG. Good fortune and the favour of the King
    Smile upon this contract; whose ceremony
    Shall seem expedient on the now-born brief,
    And be perform'd to-night. The solemn feast
    Shall more attend upon the coming space,
    Expecting absent friends. As thou lov'st her,
    Thy love's to me religious; else, does err.
              Exeunt all but LAFEU and PAROLLES who stay behind,
  LAFEU.

COUNTESS
ROLLES. Well, thou hast a son shall take this disgrace off me:
    scurvy, old, filthy, scurvy lord! Well, I must be patient; there
    is no fettering of authority. I'll beat him, by my life, if I can
    meet him with any convenience, an he were double and double a
    lord. I'll have no more pity of his age than I would have of-
    I'll beat him, and if I could but meet him again.

LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
FEU. Go to, sir; you were beaten in Italy for picking a kernel
    out of a pomegranate; you are a vagabond, and no true traveller;
    you are more saucy with lords and honourable personages than the
    commission of your birth and virtue gives you heraldry. You are
    not worth another word, else I'd call you knave. I leave you.
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Good, very, good, it is so then. Good, very good; let it
  BERTRAM. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
RTRAM. Undone, and forfeited to cares for ever!
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. What's the matter, sweetheart?
  BERTRAM. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
RTRAM. Although before the solemn priest I have sworn,
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. What, what, sweetheart?
  BERTRAM. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
RTRAM. O my Parolles, they have married me!
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. France is a dog-hole, and it no more merits
  BERTRAM. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
RTRAM. There's letters from my mother; what th' import is I know
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Ay, that would be known. To th' wars, my boy, to th'
  BERTRAM. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
RTRAM. It shall be so; I'll send her to my house,
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Will this capriccio hold in thee, art sure?
  BERTRAM. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
RTRAM. Go with me to my chamber and advise me.
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Why, these balls bound; there's noise in it. 'Tis hard:
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Why, these balls bound; there's noise in it. 'Tis hard:
    A young man married is a man that's marr'd.
    Therefore away, and leave her bravely; go.
    The King has done you wrong; but, hush, 'tis so.      Exeunt
  HELENA. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. My mother greets me kindly; is she well?
  CLOWN. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
OWN. She is not well, but yet she has her health; she's very
  HELENA. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. If she be very well, what does she ail that she's not very
  CLOWN. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
OWN. Truly, she's very well indeed, but for two things.
  HELENA. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. What two things?
  CLOWN. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
OWN. One, that she's not in heaven, whither God send her quickly!
  CLOWN. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
OWN. One, that she's not in heaven, whither God send her quickly!
    The other, that she's in earth, from whence God send her quickly!
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Bless you, my fortunate lady!
  HELENA. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. I hope, sir, I have your good will to have mine own good
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. You had my prayers to lead them on; and to keep them on,
  CLOWN. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
OWN. So that you had her wrinkles and I her money, I would she
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Why, I say nothing.
  CLOWN. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
OWN. Marry, you are the wiser man; for many a man's tongue shakes
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Away! th'art a knave.
  CLOWN. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
OWN. You should have said, sir, 'Before a knave th'art a knave';
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. Go to, thou art a witty fool; I have found thee.
  CLOWN. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
OWN. Did you find me in yourself, sir, or were you taught to find
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. A good knave, i' faith, and well fed.
  HELENA. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. What's his else?
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. That you will take your instant leave o' th' King,
  HELENA. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. What more commands he?
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. That, having this obtain'd, you presently
  HELENA. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. In everything I wait upon his will.
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES. I shall report it so.
  HELENA. 
5
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. I pray you.                              Exit PAROLLES
  HELENA. 
5
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
HELENA
COUNTESS
LENA. I pray you.                              Exit PAROLLES
    Come, sirrah.                                         Exeunt
  LAFEU. 
5
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
HELENA
COUNTESS
FEU. But I hope your lordship thinks not him a soldier.
  BERTRAM. 
5
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
HELENA
COUNTESS
RTRAM. Yes, my lord, and of very valiant approof.
  LAFEU. 
5
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
HELENA
COUNTESS
FEU. You have it from his own deliverance.
  BERTRAM. 
5
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
HELENA
COUNTESS
RTRAM. And by other warranted testimony.
  LAFEU. 
5
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
HELENA
COUNTESS
FEU. Then my dial goes not true; I took this lark for a bunting.
  BERTRAM. 
5
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
HELENA
COUNTESS
RTRAM. I do assure you, my lord, he is very great in knowledge,
  LAFEU. 
5
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
HELENA
COUNTESS
FEU. I have then sinn'd against his experience and transgress'd
  LAFEU. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
FEU. I have then sinn'd against his experience and transgress'd
    against his valour; and my state that way is dangerous, since I
    cannot yet find in my heart to repent. Here he comes; I pray you
    make us friends; I will pursue the amity
  PAROLLES. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
ROLLES.  [To BERTRAM]  These things shall be done, sir.
  LAFEU. 
6
KING
BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
HELENA
COUNTESS
FEU. Pray you, sir, who's his tailor?
  PAROLLES.

  LAFEU.

  BERTRAM.

  DUKE.

KING

BERTRAM
LAFEU
PAROLLES
COUNTESS
KE. Welcome shall they be
    And all the honours that can fly from us
    Shall on them settle. You know your places well;
    When better fall, for your avails they fell.
    To-morrow to th' field. Flourish.                     Exeunt
  COUNTESS.

UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
  COUNTESS. 
7
KING
DUKE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
COUNTESS
UNTESS.  [Reads]  'I have sent you a daughter-in-law; she hath
    recovered the King and undone me. I have wedded her, not bedded
    her; and sworn to make the "not" eternal. You shall hear I am run
    away; know it before the report come. If there be breadth enough
    in the world, I will hold a long distance. My duty to you.
                                           Your unfortunate son,
                                                       BERTRAM.'
    This is not well, rash and unbridled boy,
    To fly the favours of so good a king,
    To pluck his indignation on thy head
    By the misprizing of a maid too virtuous
    For the contempt of empire.
  CLOWN. 
7
KING
DUKE
BERTRAM
LAFEU
CLOWN
PAROLLES
COUNTESS
OWN. O madam, yonder is heavy news within between two soldiers
  COUNTESS.

  COUNTESS.

  CLOWN.

COUNTESS
OWN. So say I, madam, if he run away, as I hear he does the
    danger is in standing to 't; that's the loss of men, though it be
    the getting of children. Here they come will tell you more. For my
    part, I only hear your son was run away.                Exit
  SECOND
